Reviews.Title: “Impressive service”
Reviews.Author: cglogower1
Reviews.Content: This hotel staff could not have been better. Warm, friendly, professional service. Great room. Great location. Quarre restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ChesterLeStreet
Reviews.Content: I should give the Hotel Adlon Kempinski five stars as it is undoubtedly a wonderful hotel with great staff. However, there were a couple of negatives which I will get out of the way first. We booked direct with the hotel online and took advantage of a 'special' advance booking deal. I was a bit miffed to find that, after paying over 30 days ahead, that the prices subsequently dropped significantly due to a cancellation. We paid nearly 30% more than the later price, but were happily rewarded with a slightly better room after e-mailing the hotel. The second negative is the price of food and drink. We paid €9.50 for a bottle of mineral water which is steep in any country. Thankfully, these were the only bad points and the splendid staff and attention to details more than made up for the niggles. Our room as on the second floor overlooking an inner courtyard which, although wasn't a great view, it was blissfully quiet. Decor in the room and throughout the hotel is opulent, yet slightly 'corporate'. There seems to be quite a high number of business customers, but as it is surrounded by embassies, it's no surprise. Check-in of luggage was seamless and bags were taken and reappeared in our room on our arrival. All staff at reception spoke faultless English and the number of 'Greeters' was quite overwhelming. Bar staff were charming and efficient. Location is spectacular, with the Brandenberg date, literally a stone's throw away. The hotels right on Unter Den Linden, the main road into the city centre and shops and restaurants abound in nearby Friedrichstrasse. The Reichstag is just around the corner, through the gate and the pretty Tiergarten is a few metres away. We would recommend taking a tour bus on day one to orientate oneself as it's a large, but walkable city with many of the sights and museums in the centre around the hotel. We would certainly recommend the Adlon for a truly first-class stay, but be aware – it's not cheap

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Sven A
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just a night for a quick stopover in Berlin and am totally impressed. Entering the hotel you feel like royalty; everybody greets you, tried to help you and makes you feel special. The Rooms are really nice and in very good state. I loved the rain-shower as well as the big bathtub. They were a little bit stingy with the bathroom amenities though (no tooth brush, shaver (i forgot mine), etc. In room dining was pricy but this is to be expected. The service and quality justify those. Had a coffee in the lobby bar which is quite an experience as so much is happening there. Unfortunately I have not had time to try the breakfast buffet. I shall be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenmarkIquack
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the hotel and loved it. The only draw back is the lack of nice cafes, shops and life in the area. At night Unter der Linden is very quite.......

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa_aslp
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was excellent. No need to drag your luggage along with you to reception, it is taken from the taxi and sent straight to your room. And it continued like that....., one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in (and I have stayed in some great ones) The breakfast buffet was fantastic, and the view from the room was towards the Brandenburger Tor. The hotel is ideally located to explore on foot or walk down to one of the piers and go on a boat tour. We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the piano player whilst sipping a cocktail at the bar before going out in the evening. The indoor pool area is lovely to enjoy a relaxing dip in the pool or whirlpool and read the local papers. There are several nice traditional "Berlin" restaurants in walking distance and if you can't do without your steak, a "Blockhouse" steak restaurant is just around the corner. We will certainly stay in the Adlon again next time when we are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Denise D
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Adlon Kempinski Hotel in Berlin, it is a large and beautifully restored hotel. The location is perfect, very central. All staff were extremely friendly and attentive, the hotel was spotlessly clean. Our room was large and very comfortable, the bathroom was beautifully furnished. They seem to have thought about all the little details which made a difference. We would highly recommend this hotel and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: kainepatricia
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I visited Berlin for the first time and were truly impressed with the comfort and luxury experience offered at this hotel. Over the past couple of years I have stayed at many Leading Hotel of the World properties and can definitely attest to the fact that the Adlon is by far the best! Our room was very comfortable and well designed. The entire lighting and panel is available in each bedside table. In addition, you can set the "Do Not Disturb" button to prevent the front door bell from sounding. The bathroom is equipped with heated floors, towel racks, and wonderful amenities. Another perk we enjoyed were the bananas and chocolate bark delivered to our room on a daily basis. It was a nice touch to have complimentary WiFi in our room. The location by the famed Brandenburg Gates, the storied history, the classic decor, and the modern comforts of the Adlon are the crowning glory of this hotel. You will enjoy a 5-star experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bryceadvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip and had a renovated room in what seemed like an extension to the rear of the property (to get there the first time I had to take a lift that had two doors which implied the extension was on a different level to the main building). Very big room, nice lacquered woods, comfortable bed and big bathroom. Hotel had a lot of style as well. Would definitely stay here again. Brilliant price and location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Zey Have Vays Und Means Of Making You Like Zis Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: RelaxWithMax
Reviews.Content: Checked into a Brandenburg Gate suite with the wifey on leg 2 of our Europe trip last August (2011). - We had just watched Liam Neeson staring in the movie "Unknown" on the plane on the way to Europe and the Adlon Kempinski also starred in this movie and was centre stage for most of the plot. And the movie star tag sync'd very nicely with this hotel as we soon found out when we checked in. Excellent front of house culture, pristine lobbies and meals areas. The location is a real winner, literally at the foot of the Brandenburg gate, providing not only exceptional viewing, but in addition the opportunity for early morning walks or runs around the gate and the surrounding gardens. The cafe in front of the hotel also provides the opportunity to sit and take in the passing world with magnificent views, whilst sipping on your favourite hot or cold beverage. Our room was wonderful, twin balconies providing a third floor overview of the gate and surrounding areas. Old world in style, but still with all the mod cons you need. Huge bathroom with the suite as well as a large entry foyer. - Very "Grand" in terms of style. We would have to say that the breakfast was one of the best we have ever had anywhere. "snappy service" is also a standard feature of the breakfast experience. It wasn't just the range and quality of the food that made it so good, but the attention to detail with what you ordered was of note. - They went out of their way to make sure you got what you wanted the way you wanted it. Breakfast is served in either an airy atruim area, or the restaurant at the front of the building. Depending on usage requirements. - There was a large group staying when we were there and they were allocated the atrium for breakfast. The vast lobby lends itself to a variety of areas for sitting, eating and also relaxing in the bar. Nice layout with a good look and feel to it. A very nice hotel experience and definately worthy of its 5 star rating. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like this kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Came here straight from a night at Soho House Berlin and the difference was marked. The Adlon is a very good, very large, very busy hotel but lacks soul. The room was ok but the bathroom was very cramped and it was a waste of time having two sinks as you couldn't really get two people in there. The hallways and lifts are confusing as you have to take different lifts if you want to get to the spa or gym. As usual with large hotels it was impossible to book a treatment as they were full up. Was told we should have booked earlier but maybe earlier I didn't know I needed a treatment?? The pluses are location and the staff - both excellent. If you like big, corporate and 'posh' you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar”
Reviews.Author: HoffaFin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Adlon and it was my second stay there. The Hotel couldn't be more central, right at the Brandenburger gate! With it's history and glamor, friendly service, gorgeous rooms and excellent food it is a true 5-star Hotel. I was happily surprised when i noticed that now they had free wirless internet connection all over the Hotel. The rooms are gorgeous, clean, up to date and and the bed/pillows are perfect - not a single night i had problems with having my 8 hours sleep. If you a friend of good wines and champagne this Hotel definately has something to offer! The concierge service was excellent, they easily and quickly got us tickets for the opera and could recommend us some really good Curry wurst places (if you don't know what a curry wurst is you definately have to try). I only can recommend this Hotel if you wish high quality, good food, excellent ambient and rooms and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's best”
Reviews.Author: roxyviva
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this fabulous hotel. Could not fault it on anything. It was all and more than I expected it to be. The staff were extremely polite and attentive. Don't forget your swimsuit - the leisure facilities are immaculate. I was fortunate to have the pool and sauna to myself on all three occasions I used it. The lobby area can get busy at times especially in the evenings when the many function rooms are being used, but this adds to the fun of people watching when relaxing and listening to the piano player after a hectic day of sight seeing. Best hotel experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and superior”
Reviews.Author: neil l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything a city hotel should be. From arrival guests are treated with an old fashioned and bygone charm. Guests are valued-check in is sppedy and minimal The rooms are modern-large-superbly clean and appointed-the bathrooms are marble and recently done. The dining room for breakfast must be one of the best in Europe-fresh everything-nothing is overlooked or left to chance. Superbly good value. Magnificent and efficient staff. There must be nothing that escapes the GM's attention. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Tourist-LHW
Reviews.Content: Doorman- Friendliness was ok however the welcome attitude was not meeting Kempinski standards was expecting a little more emphasis on the word "Wellcome" Reception - Fulfills their task according to standart procedure with no extra effort to make the guests feel at home. Kempinski Adlon team seems to be overwhelmed with the occupancy they currently have it is a full house simply it is what a hotel has to be in regards to service standards and attitude i am sure they deliver a great service when they have less occupied rooms so definitely not my choice for next years ITB my room preference was indicated to be uppor floors and i have recieved 1st floor at display of all citizens of Berlin, privacy and room amenities are in poor quality and non-existent. Ritz Carlton and Mariott is my preference in Berlin, do not believe in all the good marketing made for this hotel due to its higher price ranges instead of paying 300E here better pay 500E ın Ritz and to be pampered as you deserve to be

Reviews.Title: “SEVEN STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKUSATraveler
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor you rating is not sufficient for this fabulous hotel! The Adlon is a 7 star hotel! The location at the Brandenburg Tor ( gate) is priceless, so is their service, history and hardware! SAVE A DINNER FOR THE LAURENCE ESSZIMMER!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SiberianHamster
Reviews.Content: Splendid welcome and an excellent room with view over Unter den Linden to the Brandenburg Gate. Service was personable without intrusion or insincerity evident in some establishments. Only issue was placed in a smoking room despite non-smoking request although more than adequately compensated by views. Upgrade to a suite worth the outlay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: MichelleAW
Reviews.Content: The hotel has such a great story to tell - its history, its location, its infrastructure, its service, its people. Top class experience! I don't usually eat in the hotel I stay. But Adlon is different - I couldn't get enough of the fine dinning which is presented in such a simple manner.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: Marianna_Smolina
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Rooms are rather small but very cosy. Breakfast is wonderfull.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR WEEKEND BREAK”
Reviews.Author: Parkinson
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and probably the best hotel in Berlin. Unable to use restaurant as fully booked . Rooms and public areas excellent. Expensive, but if you can afford it stay a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Don't want to go home”
Reviews.Author: MFleischer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adlon is one of the best hotel I ever stayed in - it is classic, elegant, with beautiful stylish interior, a great location and has a service level that all other hotels should envy them. The moment you meet the doorman you feel welcome, and it continues through out the entire hotel - Check-in, Room Service, cleaning, restaurants (and there are several to choose from) and everywhere you go in the hotel you are greeted by a very dedicated staff. It is 3rd time I have stayed at the Adlon and all rooms have an incredibly high standard - in addition to the usual things that must be present on first class hotel also include the possibility to choose from a wide selection of different pillows, shoeshine service and several other things. The hotel has a large exquisite spa area with many different offers, the fitness room is large and bright and is equipped with many different machines - both strength and cardio. Hotel Adlon is in every way a hotel you do not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Celebration”
Reviews.Author: SwedenSkifan
Reviews.Content: We had the fortune to be able to celebrate New Year at this fantastic hotel, From the arrival and check in all the way to check out was this a 5 star experience. Rooms fabulous, food exellent, service impeccable, the ice bar serving champagne and oysters before dinner was out of this world. Adlon, one of the best ever. If you want to treat yourself to something extra while in Berlin , do not hesitate to choose Adlon.

Reviews.Title: “touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Goaorbust
Reviews.Content: This place would normally be out of my budget, espically since i ended up in a suite that was bigger than most flats i visit in London. But my company was paying so i sat back and enjoyed the good life. From arrival, when i was offered a glass of sparkling wine to leaving, the stay was excellent. My suite offered a standard of living i have so far never expereinced, with a small gym-like room containing an exercise bike to the sauna in the bath room. The only negatives i could remark on were that i had to repeatedly order a beer in the bar before it arrived and that the breakfast in regards to food was okay (but the set up was impressive). But these points take nothing away from a great hotel, with great service and great location in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “the absolute top”
Reviews.Author: Delorie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in freezing Berlin. Everything in this beautiful is the absolute top. Everything the spoiled traveller wants. Spacious, classic rooms, with lots of light and very comfortable beds, dressingroom, black marble bathrooms, where you can take a bath while sun is streaming in. If we were not so anxious te discover Berlin, we would have loved to stay the whole three days in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: mlillywh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a company event so I can't comment on the price. What I can say is the location is brilliant - eating breakfast looking at the brandenburg gate is superb. 5 minutes from the Reichstag (3 days notice if you want to do the atrium tour). The spa, pool, bar & restaurant are all excellent. Rooms were pretty special with a comfy bed and well insulated! It's probably the best hotel I have stayed in in Europe

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnot stay here”
Reviews.Author: Faulkner8251
Reviews.Content: poor service, poor lodging and a weak front desk staff add up to poor experience. They actually lied about my ability to upgrade to a higher grade room, which I was able to do online at the front desk. Room Service was for a simple coffee was bad. For 300 EU a night for a poor room, we weren't allowed access o the hotel for 30 minutes as a political dignitary was in town. This is simply wrong

Reviews.Title: “one of world's finest”
Reviews.Author: bruce t
Reviews.Content: wandering through europe with my son, we stopped in berlin after iceland/denmark/norway and decided to splurge. hotel staff greeted us like we were bank presidents and not old hippie and teen-ager with backpacks. received magnificent room up-grade with huge opening windows on top floor over-looking brandenberg gate. lobby/bar/breakfast all world class. have stayed in many five star establishments, but never had better room or hospitality. kempinski is always first class, but this hotel truly rates its flag-ship status. stay here , if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin epitomized”
Reviews.Author: rajshankar
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels I have stayed in some 100 plus international hotels. The hospitality was something that I had never experienced before - disciplined. The location is the finest. I could just walk out of the hotel and there would be fun and frolic all around. The big Gate that is so much German in it's appearance is awsome. And though the restaurants in the hotel serve the finest fod, I would recumbent a walk out of the hotel to the restaurants close by. And the sausage stand just outside the door is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good old fashioned luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lars_Pjokken
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were asked if we would upgrade to a better room. We got three options and went for the best one; a two room suite on the 2nd floor with a view to the Brandenburger Tor. Expensive, but a really nice experience. This was actually two separate rooms with a double door that, in this case, was open. Thus we had two bathrooms, one with a sauna, and two minibars! Very nice, kind of old fashioned style and excellent location in the middle of Berlin. All members of the staff were very nice and polite. For the price they charge for the rooms, breakfast should be included. This is actually outrageous! Also free wi-fi should be obvious in this kind of hotel in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: As soon as I made eye contact with the front entrance valet, and I am still maybe 40 feet away walking towards the entrance, he came running to relieve me from my suitcase. I was then shown/escorted to the reception desk with 5 more staff members waiting to help me. A glass of champagne was poured, and I once again was escorted to my room by a staff member, who then explained all different switches that can be found in the room. Some people might say this is "too much", but I think it is proper service. My suitcase came within 5 minutes of me checking into my room (when I am still being debriefed about the switches), and then a vase of flowers, and then a plate of petit fours. My suite faces the Unter de Linden with a view of the Brandenburg Gate (if you stick your head out of the window and look to your left). Although on the second floor, the sound proof windows kept the noise outside. As others have mentioned, the bath products are superb, and the heated floor is a wonderful addition. Room service is prompt. Everybody I have met was extremely courteous, and they also seem to remember my name. I feel very safe at this location with the security presence as well as guests have to parade through the reception area before able to reach the elevators, of which are card keys operated only. The formal restaurant is closed for the week, so I ended up having dinner at their Cafe, which was pretty decent as well. There are plenty of eateries around the neighborhood and walking around that area at night was not a problem either since there are extra securities patroling the embassy district surrounding the hotel. Unlike the Ritz in London where gentlemen guests were to wear ties and jackets, even in the lobby area, I felt at ease wearing jeans and ski jacket. I would pick this over the Ritz Carlton simply based on location and what is around.

Reviews.Title: “Just too expensive”
Reviews.Author: ronniemarks
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for xmas and decided to treat ourselves to this hotel and wish we hadn't. No reflection on the room or facilities as they are top class as you would expect of a top hotel. The issue was what were ridiculous costs for drinks and meals. I've stayed in a lot of hotels but never paid Euro$78 for breakfast or euro$40 for 2 drinks at the bar. If its meant to keep the riff raff out then it works as i wouldn't go back but what you get is lots of 'pretentiousness' with staff walking around holding peoples 'rat' dogs for them and no atmosphere in the bar or restaurants. Location is perfect looking onto the Brandenburg gate but not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious landmark hotel”
Reviews.Author: aleksandarBeograd
Reviews.Content: Great location in Berlins Mite.,beside Brandenburg Gate ! The spacious inviting but busy lobby,well trained staff . Always looking for deluxe king 40 sq metre,elegant.spacious rooms with marble bathrooms ! (no coffee maker,no free internet) Beautifule spa with neoclassical indoor swimming pool !Excellent buffet breakfast. Highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: revilo77Dubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adlon for the very first time in December 2011. Being a hotelier myself I had great expectations which I have to say were not just met, they were exceeded. I arrived by taxi and the bellman opening the door greeted me by name. Very impressive. He took care of the luggage and accompanied me to the reception. A friendly young man checked me in and even upgraded me to a nice Junior Suite. A Russian hostess brought me to my room and showed me the amenities. Some people may like this but I personally find this a touch too much as she was talking all the way not realizing I was just tired and not in the mood to chat. Luggage was delivered promptly. The suite was very clean and on the 4th floor on the backside of the hotel (very quiet). Nothing was missing really except for international power plugs and maybe a larger TV in the living room (only 32in). The bed was very comfortable and I had a good night's sleep. A nice feature in the shower stall is a steambath which you need to turn on about 10mins before you want to enjoy it. The amenities are of very good quality and the bathtub has jets. Very nice. However the most awesome thing was the concierge service. I needed to move some flights around and they took care of it professionally and efficiently. Congratulations for a job very well done. Overall a perfect experience. I would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation. You do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Delight”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December for 4 nights and could not have picked a better hotel. It is right next to the Brandenburg Gate with great access around the City both on foot and in car. The hotel was excellent and certainly lived up to its 5star rating. Rooms were excellent with choice of pillows and bedside controls for lights and air con. Bathrooms were also well appointed with his and her sinks, a bath and seperate shower. Facilities in the the hotel were very good and all of a level you'd expect with a 5 star. I had several meals and drinks in thevarious restaurants and bars and not one disapointed and there was also a great choice for breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bourgeois Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smir5864
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights last summer, a woman traveling alone. My gay male cousin was staying on a different floor. In a town where almost everything is "alternative" (as Berliners like to call themselves and their city instead of grungy, vanguard, etc.) this place is a bation of bourgeois more suited to Munich or Frankfurt. The location is great, central and amid all the sights. The lobby is nice, traditional but not distinctive. Front desk service is friendly and competent. The room was spacious enough, except that it looked into a courtyard where the hotel employees came to take their cigarette breaks. But hey, I'm all for people watching and workers having breaks. The bathroom and amenities were cool. They had the bubble bath for the tub in a little honey pot, too cute! However, housekeeping wasn't that great. I stayed from a Tuesday through the week-end. On no night except on Friday (when the hotel gets crowded with locals either with wives or girlfriends) was the bed turned down. I thought, this being Berlin turn down service must've been too bourgeois :) of an expectation. But it had been offered regularly once I checked, although for some reason not in my room. Also, the bottled water wasn't replenished regularly or consistently. I called and asked for flat water, but got fizzy instead. I called back but never received any. Finally, I had to take it from the mini-bar. Annoying when the place is 5 stars, charges as such and the water is supposed to be complimentary. I guess if I had complained, they would've rectified the matter, but it just wasn't worth it. Upon my return they sent a survery to a "Mr." I completed it, letting them know that I was a female and had stayed not for a single night but a week. No reply back. So, the service isn't too personal and they don't seem to give a hoot. Still, if you aren't an alternative type, you won't find a more uber place in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Adlon, a great international hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmott2
Reviews.Content: The Adlon is a real five star hotel. It is in a prime location at the Brandenburg Gate on the Unter den Linden. It is an easy stroll to the Museum Island and an even easier stroll to the Reichtag building. To visit this you have to book on line or by email. A good way to spend the morning is to make an early visit to the Reichtag dome then have breakfast in the restaurant. This is very popular with Berliners so you need to book in advance for a weekend visit. Rooms at the Adlon are very reasonably priced by comparison with,say, London. Drinks are a bit expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “A truely Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: DKLaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 5 days and celebrated New Years Eve 2012. It was 5 days with perfect service delievered by professional staff and a butler without comparison. We got the president suite and every single detail was perfect; fresh flowers every day, champagne and fresh fruits on silver plates, chocolates and the best service ever from a butler who organized thing we even didn`t think of ourselves. To be one step ahead every single day of our stay shows how proffesional this service was. Drycleaning, shopping, extern hairdresser from berlin because the hotels hairdresser was booked,picked up medicine from farmacy, guided tour through town in the hotels car with personal driver etc Everything was perfect. Expensive yes, but once in a lifetime experience. We recommend everybody this beautiful (titanic-style) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: PWillits
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite at the Adlon, and all you can say is fabulous! Perfect service, spacious room, and the best location.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about our visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Magnus K
Reviews.Content: Read in a book that it was once the best hotel in the world, so decided to try it on a short trip with the family. The first experience at check- in was not good, because we had to wait in the lobby for over three hours, and it was after 3pm. While we waited we decided to have the Sunday brunch buffet, that was good. We would have enjoyed it more if we could have freshened up and changed out of our travel cloth. We had booked a larger room towards "under den linden"' that was very nice. The bathroom was very modern and nice. Kempinski has the best beds and linens in the hotel industry, we slept extremely well. The spa was nice, but a bit small. I enjoyed the historic program about the hotel on the tv. They have some English speaking TV channels as well. Free wi-fi is always a plus. The hotel is located right next to the Brandenburg gate, where you can also get on the "The Big Red Bus" tourist Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: outofofficeSC
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We booked at a reduced rate and were treated like we were valued repeat guests. Even someone staying in one of their best rooms couldn't possibly have been treated better, we were made to feel that special. An excellent location near many important historical sites and near public transportation with easy trips to any other part of Berlin of interest to anyone. The lobby was wonderful for afternoon tea (or delicious hot chocolate which we had) and people watching. The rooms were equipped with every convenience you could and couldn't imagine.

Reviews.Title: “nice but lacks charm and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: byswiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Adlon Kempinski Berlin just after Christmas 2011. We choose this hotel because of its affiliation to the LHW Leaders Club and because of it's reputation and history. Indeed we imagined this hotel as being Germany's landmark property. The hotel is nicely located just on the Pariser Platz facing the Brandenburger Tor. Location is certainly one of the hotel highlights. Upon arrival: check-in was friendly and efficient. The lobby and lounge area are a little dark and and feel a little crowded. We took lunch in the lobby bar. Typical hotel choices like Burgers, Club Sandwiches and some specialties. Food was decently priced, drinks a little overpriced (7€ for some water). Thnx to my Leaders Club membership we were upgraded to a superior room. The room was nice; yet don't expect antique furniture or belle epoch appliances. The room feels very much like a 5* chain room or like on a cruise ship: very much interchangeable and nothing that underlines the hotel's history or heritage. It could have been in Hong Kong, Frankfurt or Washington. Same in the bathroom: elegant luxury yet again: nothing charming or with personality. The hotel gave us a leaders club welcome gift that consisted of some fruits and some hang made chocolate: again very nice yet nothing German or berlin-like. Sleep quality was okay. Cleanliness was obviously excellent, just like in the rest of the hotel. The spa area is standard for a 5* euro-city property: a little indoor pool, some canvas chairs and a sauna and steam room area. Again nothing to write home about yet does the job. We were given complimentary continental breakfast: service was slow and breakfast room was rather crowded and busy: yet still enjoyable. A highlight about the breakfast room is the view towards the Brandenburger Tor. The continental breakfast was a nice typical German selection of vienoiseries and bakeries, ham and jelly, some cheese and some cold cuts. All in all a nice hotel, very friendly staff on a great location yet without any particular charm or personality: it feels like a chain hotel and not at all like Berlin's landmark property. To compare this hotel to the other Berlin LHW properties: yes it is better than the Berlin Kempinski Hotel Bristol. But there are much more charming alternatives like the Schlosshotel im Grunewald or the Hotel de Rome. I would probably choose a different property on my next Berlin visit. +location +staff -value for money -interchangeable property

Reviews.Title: “We got engaged in this Berlin hotel. Most romantic, festive, beautiful and elegant hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: StephanieFrasco
Reviews.Content: I entered this hotel as a girlfriend and I left as a Fiancé. What more can I say. Our three night trip over the Christmas Holiday was the best vacation I have ever experienced. I love this hotel and want to come back year after year. We probably will. First of all my boyfriend and I met in Berlin and coming to this hotel after being absent from Berlin for 2 years was quite the treat. For those of you who don't know Berlin is an amazing city that is torn between a few personalities. One side is artsy, another entrepreneurial, and another elegant. In other words there is something for everyone in Berlin. That is what makes it so magical. The elegant side I hadn't seen before and because we stayed in Berlin at the Adlon I love Berlin even more than I ever did before. THE HOTEL: It was christmas and the entire place was decorated to the nines. It was elegant and classy with a large sitting area in the center of the hotel where guests gathered over beverages, snacks and tea. I loved sitting in this area. You can people watch, admire the sights of the hotel and just take it all in. THE ROOM We were upgraded to the nicest room I have ever stayed in, (and we travel alot). It was a 3 bedroom suite. The bed was super comfortable and the room as a whole was super high tech. You can control all the lights from the bed area so you don't have to get out of bed to turn them off. Of course you can control them from other places in the room as well. I am a big bath person and the bathtub was super. The bubble bath was in a honey bottle which was cute as well. The shower was also amazing!! There was a vanity seat so I can blow dry my hair and do my makeup sitting down. Such a luxury. There was also a walk in closet that would make any girl cry! The sitting room was also nicely decorated with high class touches, but nothing was over done. It was just right. THE STAFF They are the nicest people ever. I even gave one of them a hug! Definitely make you feel like you are welcomed as their personal guest. 10 thumbs up for the staff. The LOCATION You can't get a better location that the Brandenburg gate. It is the entrance to the city. There is an S bahn and a Ubahn outside the hotel as well. Many of the most famous sites are also walking distance. Best location in berlin! WIFI! As my fiance and I travel alot for work we have to have consistent internet. The Adlon provides free wireless internet throughout the whole hotel! it always worked and was fast! I love you Adlon for this! FOOD Nothing beats a German breakfast and this one is top notch. Literally I have never seen so many jams and jellys provided or so many choices of meats, cheeses, breads, etc. at a breakfast buffet before. We also had english tea there which was wonderful and we ordered room service. All the food was great. Overall I felt like Pretty Woman while in this hotel. I am so happy that I had the opportunity to see Berlin in a different light and that we got engaged there. I will forever love this hotel and I know you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: HUH42
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin, the hotel was very good but nothing impressive. The room service menu was OK. I recommend not to visit Berlin in winter, its very cold and its kind of sad. Norman Foster's dome was incredible, don't miss it, and don't forget to reserve.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JetSetNomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adlon Hotel for 3 nights to celebrate the Christmas Eve and Christmas Day holidays -- from Dec 24 to Dec 27. Our stay was absolutely unforgettable! I actually chose this hotel as the location for my proposal to my girlfriend (now fiancé) and I am SO HAPPY I did. The Professional Staff There are so many amazing things about the Adlon Hotel, but it all begins and ends with their charming, professional, and uber helpful staff. Every single person working at this hotel is on his or her "A Game" every single day. Before our stay, I booked the reservation directly on their website and added flowers, champagne, and limousine airport pick-up service. Then, I contacted the hotel staff by email to let them know about my marriage proposal plans to see if they could assist in co-ordinating the details so I could make my proposal as spectacular as possible. From the very first email (and the 10 or so messages that followed) the staff was AMAZINGLY HELPFUL and treated me like a VIP guest. I want to give specific thanks to Paula Lena Lensch and Susanne Exl -- both from the reservations ("behind the scenes") staff who helped me make everything happen. Also, the lady who checked us in and the gentleman who guided us to our room both did an outstanding job. I simply cannot thank these people enough for their creativity and their helpfulness. THANK YOU SO MUCH! Upon arriving on our flight to the Berlin airport, our driver was waiting at the very front of the passenger exit door from the luggage claim. He was immediately very friendly and carried our luggage to the car. While driving to the hotel, he provided really insightful comments about Berlin and the sights as we passed them. Very informative guy! Once we arrived to the hotel, we felt immediately like royalty. If you've never seen the Adlon Hotel, it's located right on Pariser Platz next to the Brandenburg Gate. As our German friends put it so well, staying at the Adlon Hotel is like staying at the White House. You feel like a royal guest and a diplomatic figure of international importance all at once! The front desk staff checked us in speedily and treated us like old friends. They upgraded our room and took us directly upstairs. We always felt like they knew us and we'd stayed there many times before! Our Immaculate Suite What can I say? Our room #508 was ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! This two-room suite looks out directly to the Brandenburg Gate and, since it was Christmas time, the beautiful Christmas tree and menorah out in the open square of Pariser Platz. We also had a direct view of the United States Embassy near the Brandenburg Gate. Our suite included a beautifully decorated entry way, full-size living room, large bedroom, walk-in closet, and full-size bathroom. We've stayed in lots of hotels all over the world -- and many of them very nice as well -- but nothing compares to the room we had at the Adlon. We will never forget it! The Cozy Lobby Area While staying at the hotel, we took advantage of the charming & cozy lobby area many times. We enjoyed coffees, wines, beers, and even the famous "Afternoon Tea at Adlon" experience. Everything was delicious and carefully prepared. The staff were all incredibly nice and helpful all day and all night long. Despite working during the Christmas holiday, everyone did an exceptional job and made us feel comfortable and welcome every single minute. Bravo! Even if you never stay at the Adlon Hotel, I highly recommend just stopping in to enjoy some wonderful people watching in the lobby area. Worth every euro! Location, Location, Location One factor that really makes the Adlon Hotel so ideal for staying in Berlin is its location. Sure, maybe other hotels offer similar access to the sights -- maybe some are even better located for that purpose. But I can't stress this enough -- staying at the Adlon is like staying at the Buckingham Palace. You just feel part of everything in a very special way. Near to the hotel, we easily found nice shops, cafes, and restaurants to enjoy. This place has it all! And you never get tired of looking at the Brandenburger Tor. Wireless Internet Wifi is really important to us when we travel. The wireless Internet at Adlon was reliable, easy-to-use, and widely available. And... it's FREE! The Epitome of "Grand Hotel Luxury" What more to say? I love grand hotels, and I've stayed at some really great places, but NOTHING tops the Adlon in these terms. When Lorenz Adlon created this grand palace, he wanted to make sure the guests felt exceptionally important but also right at home. That's a rare combination and this hotel pulls it off in spades. It's grand luxury at its finest without all the pretentious side-effects. If you love grand hotels and you're planning a trip to Berlin, there are simply no other options. Stay at the Adlon and be part of the magic!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: This place is simply awesome. Stayed only one night here and got upgraded from executive room to a deluxe room with a view to the Brandenburger Tor (however it was only the Quadriga we could see). The rooms are quite large and with equipped with nice furniture. The bathroom has a separate shower, baththub and a toilet in a separat room. The bed was a bit too hard for me to be honest. It was totally quiet and you couldn'thear anything from the neighbouring rooms like in most other hotels. There are European and US sockets but they are in a locker on the other side of the room. So you can't charge your laptop/ipad and sit in bed surfing the web unless you have 3m power cable. The breakfast was very good with fish, eggs, several cereal & jam options. However I had a bit the feeling that the people with furs etc. were served always first nevertheless the service was good and quick. Beware of the of the prices in general: breakfast is between 29-45€, a piece of cake 7,50€ or a capuccino 7€. Wifi is free. To summarize it was the best hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful ,but very badly let down by their Italian restaurant !!”
Reviews.Author: john g
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to this wonderful place to celebrate my 80th birthday . We stayed for 3 nights and the whole experience was made so special by all the staff who were always trying to 'look after us'. We were offered a\ glass of Champagne upon arrival and this set the 'tone' for the whole experience. I had never been to Berlin before ,so I had no idea about the hotel location. That is one of it's assets as it is in a very peaceful area and is very close to the Brandenburger Tor . The hotel is expensive ---drinks ,snacks cost a lot ,but this is to be expected in a hotel of this quality. Our room was very ,very comfortable and we were very impressed by the security systems in the hotel--it would be very difficult for a non-resident to visit any of the bedroom floors. We only ate in one of the hotel restaurants .The Italian one !! A big mistake ,as the food was awful. So bad that I returned one course.We live in Italy for long periods each year and have a good appreciation of Italian quality food . We were very ,very disappointed by this restaurant ..As this was the final evening of our holiday it rather spoiled our celebration. This is the ONLY reason I am giving the Adlon 4 stars instead of 5. On the other two evenings we went out to two German restaurants . Both in different ways very good indeed. The Aigner--superb service --and Zur Letzten Instanz,which is a very traditional restaurant (no Credit cards taken here).Both restaurants were booked for us by the Adlon and the Aigner was told it was my birthday,so there was the usual greeting at the end of our meal . Only one candle to blow out I'm pleased to say. If I make it to 90 I hope we will be able to repeat the whole wonderful Adlon experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: howellsk1984
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in!From the champagne arrival, to the our checkout it was fabulous. My husband and I were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversay, and I have to say I dont think we could have gone to a better hotel. The staff are very attentive, and friendly especially those on reception and concierge. Our room was fabulous, the bath and the shower were totally brilliant (I want both in my house). It is a very high class hotel and I would suggest taking nice/smart clothes to wear (e.g. a nice coat/jacket not a walking jacket etc). If you do stay here you also need to try the day spa as this was totally gorgeous. Have not got anything negative to say!!! Just a Brilliant break and was sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lp0503
Reviews.Content: The service was great, anything I needed, they went out of their way to accommodate. And tastefully decorated and peaceful rooms, nice bathtub. Not to mention the great location! I was happy there.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: cubism
Reviews.Content: Everthing is perfect: history, location, rooms with a view (unter den Linden), friendly helpful staff - Andre, waiting with me in the cold for a taxi in the middle of the street when all was cordoned off due to a President's visit, The magic of letting one feels you are the most important guest. Old world principles and charm. Magic breakfasts and a spa that could be called the best in Europe. Fresh flowers and fruit - and the best lebkuchen in the whole wide world. Do not let a stay at this hotel pass in your lifetime .....

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every Way”
Reviews.Author: gofbudapest
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel was a real joy! Perfectly situated adjacent to the Brandenburg Gate the hotel offers convenient access to Berlin's many attractions. The beautiful lobby is but a taste for the rest of the property. The service is impeccable as one would expect and the food matches! Staying here for a week was well worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: montage2000
Reviews.Content: We had a three day luxurious stay at the Adlon. The hotel truly captures the christmas spirit with its beautiful and unique decorations. Staff members were well groomed, helpful and efficient. Our room was spacious and very comfortable and the room temperature easy to control. Breakfast was excellent with a wide variety and a view of the brandenburg gate. The location of the hotel is also great, it is close to main attractions. We took a two day bus tour recommended by the concierge and also visited the christmas market walking distance from the hotel. The hotel lobby bar is always busy, we sat there one evening for a cocktail and enjoyed the atmoshere along with life entertainment. On our last day there was a group of carol singers in the lobby bar singing as afternoon tea was being served. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SebsGenolier
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin for a surprise visit on my sisters Birthday. we stayed in the Adlon and it was really an experience like never before. The moment you step in you feel welcome and all staff are friendly and very helpful. the food is really amazing. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Majesty at its best!”
Reviews.Author: jrdixon4121
Reviews.Content: As a reward to myself, I spent 2 nights at the Adlon and enjoyed the atmosphere, room, and cuisine which was beyond description. Wish I could have experienced the original Adlon of lore but this visit was superlative in the maximum sense!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence steps from the Brandenburg Gate”
Reviews.Author: Cindyh98
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay in Berlin where I was privileged to have stayed at the iconic Hotel Adlon Kempinski. This prestigious hotels merits its reputation and has an optimum location steps from the Brandenburg Gate and situated in close proximity to the many historic sites of Eastern Berlin and the trendy galleries of Mitte. The hotel has an old world ambience with well appointed sleeping rooms and public spaces. The heart of the property is the staff. Members of every service of the hotel from the concierges to housekeeping staff to servers in the restaurant go beyond the expected. They are polite and anticipate guests' needs. I do hope I will return to this memorable home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing combination of THE BEST in everything ..”
Reviews.Author: LucaMT
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Fabulous lobby, reception and concierge. Amazingly efficient staff. Service impeccable. Rooms are superb - with everything you could ever wish for. If you miss a bath robe, simply ask ! Best beds ever. Food marvellous: from the sumptuous breakfast buffet, to lunch and dinner in the 2 star Michelin rates restaurant on the 1st floor. Spa and pool and health Center facilities top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Awesome! Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: katjuscha007
Reviews.Content: Together with my husband we spend 3 wounderful nights in the Adlon. The atmosphere of the hotel is amazing. The lobby looks like a lobby in the golden 1920's. The rooms are spacious and so well designed. I'm still impressed. We loved the perfect designed bathroom. So genius. And the staff is really perfect trained and friendly in a nice way. The breakfast is amazing. Fresh strawberries, blue berries and nice steaks. Great cheese... I cannot really decide, what I like most. Bottom line: We spend some nice time together in this amazing hotel and will come back. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Adlon Kempinski, mythical hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristineGrisel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, too short to visit everything. So many museums! So classy and such good taste. Not snobby at all. Very friendly staff, always ready to help. The buffet breakfast at 39 euros per person had everything one could want, a huge varied fare of very good quality. Just for a change we went to Café Einstein, on the right after leaving the hotel, and it was really good too but at half the price of Adlon’s but at Adlon there is so much luxury and service that we just had to have our meals there. The room was spacious and there was a beautiful shower. Luxury bathroom products as is to be expected. Only thing we found strange was that there was nobody who would come in the evenings to turn down the bed for the night and with a little chocolate or something. This is what normally happens at this type of hotel but to tell you the truth, we were quite happy with that. Sometimes we find this a little bit too much, depending on our moods. Wonderfully placed so close to the Brandenburg Gate and if you get to the dining room early, (it opens at 6) you can enjoy your breakfast in such an idyllic setting, looking at the Brandenburg Gate just in front of you with nobody on the road. Bliss. The personnel catered to our every needs. There were quite a few receptions going on at the far end of the hotel and unfortunately it was here that we took the lift to get to our room faster. Due to this, we were not allowed to cross over to the far end and had to take another direction to get to our room. But this was not a big problem. There is a small room downstairs where you can smoke but it’s preferable to go outside as even though it’s aired, it’s quite smoky in there. Internet was free. Didn’t have time to use the spa or the pool. Buy a Berlin Card public transport ticket to take you everywhere without the bother of always looking for change. You just hop on and hop off any bus, tram or tube. My husband got stopped once (but not me even though we were together) by a security guard at the entrance who wasn’t very tactful or gentle in his way. I didn’t like that at all. Lots of tourist traps as with everywhere. 2 euros, fixed price, to be photographed next to the “soldiers”, Checkpoint Charly, false Berlin wall stone ….. Pottsdam just has to be visited, take a touring bus with headphones. Go on a boat cruise to shave a different view. Wonderful stay all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: dorisbl
Reviews.Content: All the great things have already been said about this fantastic hotel...but I'd like to add that they have a great concierge service...they help you with anything you can think of...my thanks to all of them, specially to Ermano.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but huge!”
Reviews.Author: gamekeeper
Reviews.Content: A really comfortable hotel and brilliantly sited for the Brandenburgh Gate. Room was first class (my husband is very tall and we had plenty of space). The room was really quiet and extremely well sound proofed - we never heard anyone else! Nice touches like the bed being turned down in the evening and free shoe cleaning. The staff were friendly without being 'in your face'. The lack of free internet in rooms was a pain but you can use the business centre free for 30 minutes per day. We had a package that included breakfast. The first day it was very good, except we werent given a menu and so missed out on some of the cooked food available but wonderful fresh juices and superb bread. Our waiter smiled the whole time! The second day service was not so good and coffee was asked for several times before it actually arrived. Third day was dreadful! There was a function in the dining room and so breakfast was in another place with completely different staff. I asked for eggs Benedict and after 1/2 hour wait they arrived - cold and inedible! I think the manager of this hotel should pay a visit to Le Meridien in Budapest - a REALLY first class 5 star hotel! Would I go back to the Adlon? Probably not - but we enjoyed it just the same.

Reviews.Title: “"THE PLACE"”
Reviews.Author: genovevaK
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Adlon for 5 days and we loved it. When I travel, hotel location is very important for me, because I like to walk around a lot, and I can not think of a better location in Berlin, many of the main sites are walking distance. The rooms are really spacious and luxurious, We got one of the suites overlooking the Branderburg Gate and I slept every night with the curtains open just to enjoy the magnificient view. Service and food were excelent, the buffet breakfast is served at the restaurant that overlooks the Gate also, and to top all that, Max the doorman greeted us by our name every time when we returned to the hotel, I could not believe that he actually remembered our names, His great personality makes him a perfect representative of the hotel. I want to make a point that if you want to visit the Reichstag you have to make reservation in advance at their webpage: http://www.bundestag.de/htdocs_e/visits/kupp.html

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: BeachSwaggie
Reviews.Content: The Adlon is a Berlin classic. It is elegant, historic, wonderfully located. Service is excellent and food very good. There may well be better hotels in Berlin but, money aside, why bother? A great place to stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “A classic”
Reviews.Author: DennyUK
Reviews.Content: Given its location next to the Brandenburg Gate, this hotel could probably prosper well just on its history and the unbeatable location. Kudos to the Kempinski management for not giving in to this temptation. This hotel is just excellent in every respect and is improving further - e.g. the hotel spa is OK but nothing spectacular. Now there is a day spa in the same building as the hotel that is really impressive - I am not sure if it actually belongs to the hotel, but it's worth booking a treatment just to soak in the atmoshere. Also, while not cheap, I think the Adlon is a very good value for money, considering this is the top hotel in an capital city. Compared to good hotel London or Paris prices, Adlon actually gives you a very decent deal on the same level of service. There is just one thing one needs to get used to: the entrance lobby area appears to be something of a magnet for a certain type of slightly upscale tourists who come in for a cup of coffee or just to have a look and make a few pictures. This makes the lobby always crowded and often noisy. However, all this stops few meters behind the lobby bar and the rest of the house is quite a bliss. Maybe the street visitors are the reason why Adlon recently introduced the institution of red-coated young women called "guest relationship managers" who hang around the lobby and appear to have no other task than to engage in small talk with arriving guests and help them with the check-in procedure. Since I feel like I am spending at least a third of my life in hotels, I am well able to check in on my own and when arriving at a hotel, my priority is to get the room key and to get the luggage delivered asap. So being charm-bombed by the girls did not quite do it for me and it introduced a disturbingly Las Vegasque element into an otherwise serene and cultivated European environment.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and still friendly”
Reviews.Author: gabisch
Reviews.Content: We have stayed last week for five nights in the Adlon Berlin. This was a great experience. Warm and friendly staff. comfortable accommodation, with all possible facilities. excellent location. We will stay there again next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay good location too many tour buses”
Reviews.Author: elainevedette
Reviews.Content: With so many choices in Berlin this is a good one for location but too busy and for the price there are better choices! The lobby was filled with convention people and tourists off bus tours. It was a little crazy and a ton of Americans.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a heart”
Reviews.Author: magpie172
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything expected of a 5 star hotel but also a little bit extra. During my stay the Prime Minister of Bangladesh was at the hotel. There were lots of Bangladeshis wandering around who had obviously not stayed at a hotel of this caliber. The staff was just as pleasant & accommodating to them as they were to their regular clients. Surely the mark of a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Sure it's a Grande Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: milessmilesalone
Reviews.Content: You know you are in a high class place when the guy who checked you in at the front desk remembers your name throughout your stay. Makes you feel a bit like royalty indeed. I liked the place, wouldn't have paid the price if it weren't for my client, but I do admit I loved the feeling of walking in not as a gawker but as a guest. However, what I will probably never get over is the sticker shock of food & bev at this place. €10 for a bottle of water out of the minibar? €49 for breakfast? (not included in the price of the room, mind you). So even if you manage to get some killer rate out of the internet, beware when you go for a drink or have something to eat. Tip for those who dont want to get gauged for breakfast - just down the street there is a cafe called Einstein. GREAT breakfast for....... 10% of the Adlon!! Rooms were great here, with super showers and good desk to work from. Although, it would have been nice to have a plugin next to the desk so I could charge my electronics. And, I think Wifi was something like €12 an hour so that seemed a bit steep for even top earners. End of story: I would probably go back for a very special occasion, or if my client pays again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly International Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIDAYE
Reviews.Content: A typical 4 or 5 start international hotel but the difference being all of the staff were not only helpful but friendly, cheerful and genuinely seemed to enjoy their work. Room rate was very reasonable. Only negatives would be: Prices in the hotel were outrageous. e.g. €9.50 for a small bottle of water from the minibar - how can that be! They had a conference on that weekend (which no doubt, given the nature of the hotel, is common) and, as a result, all the hotel guests in the "other half of the hotel" had to take an even more circuitous route to their rooms - must have to walk close to a 1/4 mile from reception to the room (plus two lift trips), and you are highly likely to get lost in the process. The hotel is two buildings joined together and to get from one to the other (floors are different heights) you have to take a lift. The main lounge was often full with no room for a big group to sit together, although staff were very helpful in trying to find a solution)

Reviews.Title: “Experiencing Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: hac210
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several five star hotels but have never experienced the luxury and shear enjoyment of the Adlon Kempinski in Berlin recently. There was nothing you could ask for in so far as amenities in the junior suite in the newest portion of the hotel. Anything that may have been missing could be supplied. The furnishings were exquisite and in excellent taste. The beds were extremely comfortable and had the finest linens. The bathroom suite had a superb rain shower with a steam component. There was also a tub with whirlpool equipment that was larger than most hotels provide. The hotel itself was lovely in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff with a good location”
Reviews.Author: susanne h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adlon for three days and had a wonderful time. the staff were charming and very helpful. As we had a late flight out they gave us a very late check out time. The hotel is high class luxury without being overwhelming and has an excellent pool and spa. The room was very comfortable overlooking a terrace garden.The Adlon's location is very good and it is easy walking distance to historical locations like Check Point Charlie and the Wall. There are several good resturants nearby in Charlottenstrausse and the Concierge was very helpful. We had a very good time and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip that turned into a remarkable experience”
Reviews.Author: AshArrow
Reviews.Content: centrally located, hotel Adlon is quite a legend in itself in this vibrant city of Berlin. I was here principally for a 3-day conference and a couple of meetings. on work trips, where I sleep isn't a key factor so it's left to my office to coordinate but the Adlon worked its magic on me. you can't beat the views over the Brandenburger Tor. the well-maintained standards of tradition intermingled with the luxurious touches transported me each evening to another world. I hardly felt like I was in Berlin for work. the hotel houses a d very fine restaurant too. hardly needed to step out for anything. remarkable!

Reviews.Title: “This is not high grade.”
Reviews.Author: Shin17
Reviews.Content: I had three night stays at this hotel. I waited for four hours until check-in. Then they gave me the room but did not teach the way to the room. I seek room but could not reach. By asking the bar staff I could reach. When I asked at check-in, the Front staff said "you can go by stairs" just only. I had the first experience to meet the Front staff in world.

Reviews.Title: “A marathon recovery in pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: taffioso
Reviews.Content: The infamous Adlon reassured us of the Kempinski brand irrespective of where you are in the world. However, the Adlon oozes class and is a fare reflection for what you pay. We were treated exceptionally well and never felt uncomfortable in it's elegance. Staff were friendly and were able to pitch their approach with guests applicably. We enjoyed their down to earth approach and the manager also spent time with us which was more than appreciated given the night occupancy rate due to the marathon. Breakfast is dramatically overpriced which didn't inconvenience us due to my participation in the marathon (not wanting to gain too many lbs). We had a lovely suite over looking untenable den linden and were within 200m of The Brandenburg Gate. I made sure I ran a quick time in order to get back to our delightful Adlon surroundings!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellen Hotel, a First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: efarkasTeaneck_NJ
Reviews.Content: This fine hotel not only offers excellent service, attractive rooms but also seems fairly priced for an hotel of such quality. Well located it is easy walk to other Berlin neighbors as the hotel is indeed central. Buses and the subway are also within a few feet of the hotel. In back of the hotel on Wilhelm street there are many reasonably prices restaurants and even an attractive coffee shop in which one can have breakfast at a moderate fee. Needless to say food services including beverages are outrageously expensive in the hotel lounge which is often very crowded. Frankly I would have preferred a more intimate experience but can not really complain. Treats were delivered to the room on a daily basis and we were sent home with a DVD movie about the hotel's history. A good place to stay for a first Berlin visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tennisnuts1
Reviews.Content: Our family group stayed three days at the Kempinski. The hotel is very easy to get to from Tagel Airport, 20 minutes on the a regular bus takes you almost outside the entrance. We had read reviews and upgraded our room (50 euros per night supplement) as the forecast was for hot weather and the hotel had been criticised for poor air conditioning. Others in our group did not. The modern rooms were excellent, well appointed with enough sitting area for visitors. The breakfast was very good and the reception staff/ concierge very attentive and helpful. The main lobby is very grand and the hotel has a good ambience. The pool and spa area is fine but the exercise room is very basic. The criticism of the old rooms was well founded as the air conditioning is not good and can really spoil a stay in hot weather. Unless you are on a tight budget, the upgrade to a better room is desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, history, ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Debannie
Reviews.Content: My 4 days at Hotel Adlon was by far the best hotel experience I have ever had. The hotel service is unsurpassed, attentive but not irritatingly so. I got a haricut and manicure at the day spa, both were very well done with the ultimate attention to detail. Room service was prompt, the fresh fruit was very good. The breakfast buffet was huge and delicious, it was hard to decide where to begin. Although too small for swimming laps, the pool and solarium area was enjoyable and included a "bar" where they serve healthy snacks and drinks. The deluxe room was roomy and well appointed. I took several bubble baths in the large tub using a wonderfully scented bubble bath which was provided. Unlike many other hotels, I had no qualms about climbing into this pristine looking bathtub. The showere was nice. The WC was small and a little cramped. The hotel's location was perfect, we could walk to the Brandenburg Tor and many restaurants and attractions. It was also very easy to get a cab in front of the hotel or a sighseeing bus nearby. We did not spend much time in the lobby sitting area, but many people did. Live piano music in the afternoon and evening make it a wonderful place to sit and relax with tea, coffee, pastries or drinks and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, wonderful breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: nettie1
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin as part of a conference weekend and really enjoyed the experience of staying at such an iconic hotel. The location is unsurpassed - being able to see the Brandenburg Gate as you have your breakfast is quite unique. Our room was comfortable and attractively decorated though we were very disappointed to have been allocated a smoking room; the loo was particularly smoky and unpleasant. The spa and fitness facilities are well-appointed and a nice place to relax after a day of sightseeing in Berlin. The breakfast buffet is spectacular and offers a huge variety of breads, mueslis, cheeses, juices etc. Go to the buffet hungry! Otherwise, apart from the obligatory "Currywurst" on the terrace, we didn't have an opportunity to eat in the Adlon restaurant. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Finest piece of luxuary”
Reviews.Author: tvspartners
Reviews.Content: A classic hotel build to match its legendary original piece which once stood before the world war 1. It befits the tradition of luxuary, hospitality and one of the finest service. Located next to Brandenburg Gate within the shopping, cultural,political and social heartbeat of German Capital. A truly part of leading hotels of the world

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed with, ever”
Reviews.Author: Svanborg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at hotel Adlon Kempinski and were extremely pleased. Very friendly staff, excellent room and bath-room, all luxury we could want. Super breakfast, and very nice afternoon tea. And the Lorenz Adlon restaurant lived up to it´s Michelin star expectations. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomanDi
Reviews.Content: Adlon Hotel in Berlin is one of the best hotels we've ever been from bottom to the top! Very helpful and kind personnel from bellboy up to the management. One of rare hotels which kept its tradition since its inception. Would definitely recommend it to my friends and business partners.

Reviews.Title: “THE QUINTESSENTIAL DEFINITION OF LUXURY AND EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Mx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adlon for about a week this last August. We got a good rate via the Internet and the hotel offered us an upgrade to a better room even before we arrived. It's difficult not to praise the hotel on all counts: outstanding location, general ambience, room decor & installations, friendliness and attentiveness of all the staff, food & beverage quality, etc etc. To us it is easily the best hotel in Berlin, probably even in Germany, and one of the best worldwide. True, additional services (even food & drinks) can get expensive, but it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: meredith422
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Adlon for 5 nights and were pleasantly surprised at arrival. Lobby is gorgeous, rooms and bathrooms were very spacious (especially by European standards). Location does not get better. Literally in the center of the city and of course absolutely gorgeous views of the Brandenburger Tor! Definitely quite overrun by tourists coming in to get a glimpse of this historic hotel but calmed down tremendously at night which for us was fine as we ourselves were out exploring all day! Concierge was helpful in recommendations. Truly the only negative I would say is that as a younger couple I found the staff to be a bit on the rude side but you can't let snobbery ruin an amazing trip! All else was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent without being snobbish”
Reviews.Author: DevonHammer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and fantastic service. They upgraded us to a suite for free as it was my 40th birthday and couldn't have been more helpful. Excellent location and the room was of a very high standard. The breakfast is expensive, but very good and the only downside is that we didn't have time to savour it as we had a Segway Tour booked and we had to rush off. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in classivc hotel”
Reviews.Author: uktraveller1982
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here. Overall, comfortable room and nice views over Under den Linden. There's a u-bahn right outside or the staff can help with cabs/directions. Close enough to walk to Potsdamer Platz or main shopping streets around. Breakfast was great, lots of fresh fruit (seasonal berries for e.g.) and cereals although I didn't find the staff overly helpful...e.g. no offer of coffee on the first day. You do though have a choice of 2 places for breakfast so means it wasn't too busy in either. What I like about the hotel, but others might not, is that it's a central point in the city and you,ll always find poeple having afternoon tea or drinks in the lobby bar; so it's got some atmosphere rather than the more sterile/impersonal receptions. Checkin and reception staff helpful and was shown to my room. I did wish there was free wifi, as seems strange it's not more commonly free in hotels - but that's not uncommon on Berlin. Overall, I think it has a good reputation and deservedly.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but ......”
Reviews.Author: Eckberger J
Reviews.Content: Probably in the top 5 of the Berlin's luxury hotels : Wonderful lobby, architecture and decoration, efficient staff, perfect location, good restaurant. Have a coffee and a piece of cake in the bel etage (first floor with view of the lobby) , listen to the piano player and enjoy the glamorous atmosphere. The hotel has also a small shopping gallery. But the lobby and the reception are often crowded and noisy, I had to wait 10 minutes to check in. The reception desk is simply too small and has not enough staff members. The deluxe room was nice but rather like a 4 star room. It didn't have the blue bedspread (see photo on the website). It is not luxurious and spacious like the superior and deluxe rooms of the ritz carlton Berlin. The breakfast is simply too expensive (milk, a cup of coffee, jam and 5 Brötchen 23 euros). I will certainly go back but not for a room (deluxe, executive or superior). I f you really want to have a wonderful accomodation with beautiful furniture , you need to pay for an expensive suite.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, terrible tourists, terrible hotel--Avoid avoid avoid”
Reviews.Author: SF_traveller_10
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel. The service was terrible, the guests were all noisy tourists, and the place was crowded and unpleasant. The Palace restaurant overlooked a set of garbage cans, not very appetizing for breakfast, and felt like a cafeteria, but charged liked the Ritz. The staff would not give us early checkin, but gave the person after us early checkin without his asking and without giving us an explanation. We were paying over $500 a night. The location is overrun by tourist and souvernir shops plus panhandlers. Do yourself a favor and learn from our mistake; find a real five star hotel instead of just paying for it and feeling like idiots as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: candylepoint
Reviews.Content: We love this place, from the location, the service, the room and the restaurant. We have been invited there by a friend and we are sure that for our next stop in Berlin again we will be back there. Certaily one of the best hotel we have ever been. Do not hesitate to ask to the front office what to do around, they will be pleased to give you good tips.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: florinda385
Reviews.Content: Best location in Berlin directly by the Brandenburger Tor. Nothing to complain. Room was excellent. We enjoyed the fantastic breakfast in a stylish environment. Try this it pays off for sure. Be a Qeen for your stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: beck6286
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adlon for 3 nights in mid-July. We arrived early after an overnight flight from NY. We were upgraded to an executive suite with a view of the Brandenburg Gate and in our suite by 10 a.m. The suite was terrific - spacious, 2 big flat screen TVs, entry hall, living room, bedroom, and an enormous bathroom and separate powder room. The location of the Adlon is as good as it gets in Berlin - right in the middle of everything and walking distince from almost evey tourist site in the city and also one block from the Tiergarten, Berlin's Central Park. The Adlon's buffet breakfast may be the best I've ever experienced. You would be hard pressed to think of something that was not included. Just the array of perhaps 30 different jams, preserves and honey was amazing, not to mention the varieties of smoked fish, cured meat, regular and turkey sausages, cheeses, champagne, eggs any way you want them and fresh fruit and juice galore. Service was imeccable and friendly. This hotel is among the best I have ever been to and I've been to a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: sbw60
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 teenagers) greatly enjoyed our stay at the Adlon. We loved the location next to the Brandenburg gate. The breakfasts were amazing! Our stay was made more affordable through a summer special. The rooms are spacious and well organized. Loved the bathrooms! The staff was all very friendly and helpful, though there was often a line for the concierge. There was no charge to print boarding passes in the business center. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: i stay in this hotel every time i am in berlin specially during BERLINALE. it gets expensive during these times. but it was one of the best hotels i stayed during trips. subway in front of the hotel room is clean and very new

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Perraxx
Reviews.Content: Took a "delayed honeymoon" trip to Berlin with my wife, thanks to our lovely babysitter who took care of the kids while we were away. I have stayed in many beautiful hotels around the world, but the Adlon Kempinski is certainly my pick for #1 hotel of them all. First: Well, you should not speak of prices when you talk about luxury hotels. They don´t come cheap, but in this case it seemed almost a robbery on my account! We were charged with only 1.000 € for three nights at this beautiful hotel (we were even kindly upgraded free of charge to a deluxe room) PLUS the flight with Air Berlin from/to Stockholm, Sweden, no kidding! Having spent three times the money for a weekend on hotels in Paris and London, just to mention a few cities, this is a total knockout of a bargain and for a better price than the hotels who were a lot inferior to the Adlon I stayed at in those cities. This hotel is so well maintained and the staff is young, quick, smart and polite, they even tuck you in at bedtime. We had a problem with the hotel-TV remote control, and the problem was solved in less than 10 minutes. The only thing bad about our stay was that the restaurant Lorenz Adlon was closed for the summer holiday, but there are several other places to eat at in Berlin.
