I can´t say anything bad about this hotel. The location is perfect, service is excellent and the room we had was beyond beautiful. It certainly deserves the title of best hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Some faults are forgivable”
Reviews.Author: Pilot_P1
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel overall, but it loses half a star due to its age showing in places. Expect traces of black mold in the shower and be prepared for the water to change from scalding hot to freezing cold many times per minute.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: bububub
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Berlin for a couple of days and got a good rate at the Adlon so decided to stay there. It was perfect. Location, Service, Room (with upgrade), the Breakfast, Concierge... What more can I say? It seems a bit old-school in Lobby, but the rooms are modern and dont look like on the website and the service is amazing! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “only the Bar”
Reviews.Author: HarDet
Reviews.Content: warm Beer, single Malt with ice , Gin & Tonic without ice and lime, you want a drink go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Brandenburg Gate at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: tigerbeer
Reviews.Content: It felt like such a privilege to stay at the Adlon Hotel. The hotel has such a history that you really get the feel of Berlin before the war and wall. On the TV in your room you can watch a very good film about the Adlon and one of the heirs, Louis Adlon. It is worth forgetting cost and sitting in foyer at about 6pm and watch the world go by. We were there for Berlin Fashion week and lots of beautiful people were staying there .Spend a few nights at the Adlon to complete your trip to Berlin..

Reviews.Title: “First Class experience”
Reviews.Author: Marsandy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with an outstanding central location, decorated throughout to a high standard. The staff were very efficient at all levels without being obtrusive. Our room was lovely and very quiet located at the back of the hotel and to the side (same side as British embassy). Can't comment on food as we never ate in the hotel but did have drinks and tasted the best mojito ever! Only a couple of negatives 1. Wifi - would expect a hotel of this caliber to have free access without a doubt 2. It was a challenge finding our way from the leisure facilities to our room (269) - could have better signposting We will definitely return to Berlin in the future as 1 night is definitely only a taster and it would be difficult to see past the Adlon for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingbob
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, fantastic location. 5 star in most respects. Very good value rooms but the extras are overpriced (e.g. mini bar, breakfast, lounge drinks/snacks etc). No ipod dock or coffee/tea making facilities in the room. And some staff could be more friendly (though they were all very professional). But apart from those details it was a great hotel. Lovely lovely bathrooms, smart furniture in the rooms, comfy bed, all very clean. Nice pool in the basement. Classy lobby. Efficient check in and check out. Jon Arnold

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience. One of the best hotels ever.”
Reviews.Author: TechPoet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights on Holiday in July 2011. The hotel was fantastic. Truly a 5-star experience. The staff was truly exceptional. I had a number of requests of the concierge and they were all taken care of promptly. They even managed not to laugh when I asked for Harry Potter tickets. :) I would show up to them with almost no plan and say "I want to do this. How do I do it?" and they made it happen. The front desk staff was was also very welcoming and the cleaning service did an excellent job. The room was very large and well-appointed. Actually, that's an understatement. The room was beautiful. Having each nightstand able to control all of the lights in the room was an excellent touch. The bed coverings were very comfortable and the bed itself was quite decent. I also found it extremely convenient that there were some plugs in the room that would accept US style chargers. I had travel adapters, but I tend to travel with a lot of gadgets, so this really helped out. There were also little touches to the room that were fantastic, such as an umbrella and a scale already in the closet. The location of the hotel was also superb. When you step outside you can see Brandenburg Tor a hundred meters or so away and you are surrounded by many restaurants. Right across from the rear of the hotel is more shops, more restaurants, and the Jewish memorial. Across the street from the hotel is also an extremely convenient bus line that stops at a number of the interesting places in Berlin and ends right in front of the Zoo. I will absolutely stay here again. I enjoyed this hotel greatly. There were a few small things that I think could be improved, but keep in mind that these are all fairly trivial. 1. The breakfast is far too expensive. I simply skipped breakfast each day when I was there, but I would have happily paid something like 20 euro. 40 euro is simply too expensive. 2. The surf and turf from the room service is quite disappointing in size. It was well prepared but for the cost (I think 40 euro?) it was a tiny tiny portion of meat and a claw from a tiny lobster. 3. It would be nice to have a power outlet very close to the nightstands. I use my cell phone as my alarm clock and I like to have it charging and next to me as I sleep. 4. The chair at the desk is reasonable, but could be more comfortable. I think a nice classic-looking executive chair would suit the room. 5. It would be nice to have an easy way to request what kind of water is left on the table when the room is cleaned. For example, I enjoy still water very much but do not enjoy sparkling water. As you can see, all minor things, but hopefully some of them will happen. :) Either way, fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Ena193
Reviews.Content: It was our 50th wedding anniversary and the hotel were marvellous, we were given an upgrade room, champagne, fruit, chocolates, nothing was too much trouble. The room was superb, the bathroom and shower terrific, we were spoilt, the staff and the service we received was wonderful. The breakfast has to be seen to be belived, it kept us going all day! also the spa and pool are beautiful and there is ½ hour free internet each day so I was able to check with home, A trip to remember, thank you Hotel Adlon Kempinski

Reviews.Title: “History, Service and Style -- Adlon Has It All”
Reviews.Author: TSPrufrock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adlon in July along with our daughter who is a young teenager. It was first rate in every respect. The rooms were large and clean and all the amenities you'd want were available. It is pricey, but there's a reason -- the staff. Literally everyone we encountered from the cleaning staff to the doorman to the gym attendant was friendly, multi-lingual and focused on helping us have a great experience. On our last night we went to the Hotel's restaurant about 20 minutes before closing time. We were prepared to rush through the meal given the lateness of the hour, but the staff would have none of it and practically insisted that we take our time to savor our last evening. We literally felt like we were the only people that mattered to them in the world. That's world class service. The hotel is old in its lobby, but not stuffy in the least. The age of the lobby though reflects the extraordinary history of the place -- they'd be nuts to change it. The proximity to Tiergarten Park and the many beautiful government buildings as well as Potsdamer Platz are additional pluses. And for Americans looking for a taste of home -- there's a Starbucks across the street. It was a great experience and I look forward to returning with my family again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: Aust_mum
Reviews.Content: We came for a conference and the service was just great. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Like lots of hotels now, they charge for each device per day which ends up quite expensive for a laptop, iphone and ipad! I've been travelling for the past month and the bed was the hardest to date - the sweet sleeper mattresses at the Sheratons are better! Tip: If you join Global Hotel Alliance (GHA) loyalty program (free to join), wired internet is free which is good. The restaurants don't really cater for children except for breakfast, which is included in the room price and is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable but not for the young”
Reviews.Author: sascray
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early December. It was my first experience of winter in Germany!, Security was tight, screening inside the hotel due to terror sacre in europe at that time. We had our then 4 month old daughter. The room was comfortable and clean. breakfast and food was good too.I think this hotel suits more for older clients, we kinder felt out of place, we were the only couple with a child and a baby., Its a business hotel anyway, we just wanted to stay at the famous Adlon!. We spend the 3 days enjoying gluh wein at the christmas markets and abit of shopping. If you have kids i would advice you choose another hotel unless you just want to try the Adlon. I think they could do better by refurbishing the place though especially the lobby feels very old and dull, again maybe they want to maintain that old look, wouldnt know:-)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location”
Reviews.Author: israphale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2010 (only got round to writing this now as I recently recommended it to a friend) for business. It was very luxurious, with both a bath and a tropical shower! It was everything you expect of a 5 star hotel. Location is great, just next to the Brandenburg Gate. The only thing I can't comment on is the price.

Reviews.Title: “A classy full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snyderp
Reviews.Content: The Adlon has everything. Besides the top notch finish out of rooms and common areas, the service you need as an international traveler was impeccable. We got assistance with a private guide who was excellent, we got tickets to the Berlin Philharmonic the day we arrived - and got great dinner recommendations too. We rode their bikes around, had a nice spa treatment that was in an amazing day spa right there in the hotel! Rooms are very well furnished. Best covers we've encountered - and really, that's what its all about!!! And the breakfast was beyond exceptional. We were tired of the limited, crowded buffets that were "included" in hotel room rates, but you get what you pay for! An amazing assortment of fresh foods and custom hot entrees that were included in the price so, we ate well and that carried us through a full day of walking around Berlin! These people are professionals and we enjoyed every bit of our two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Elmo_Cohen
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every respect. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. I intend to stay for longer next time. Danke

Reviews.Title: “Best European Hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in at least two dozen hotels in Europe - this one took the prize. It may be too expensive for some American travelers, but if you can spring for it - do it! you will be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific time!!”
Reviews.Author: Lover-of-Travels
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Adlon for several reasons....we had a drink in the lobby bar about 7 years ago and decided that it would be fun to stay if we ever visited again. My husband being a WWII history buff had read numerous books by William L. Shirer who had stayed there prior to 1940.....this also influenced our choice.( He also purchased a book about the history of the hotel to read prior to the trip). The location is wonderful for sightseeing....the Brandenburg Gate, Unter der Linden, Potsdamer Platz, Museum Island, Tiergarten, etc. This was our second stay in Mitte so we were very familiar with some nice restaurants. This hotel was located very close to the Main Train station.....we were going off to visit Poland after our 3 night stay. I had booked the least expensive room with a special that I found on the hotel web site. Our room was very large and comfortable with a view on an inner courtyard. It was serviced well. The bed, pillows, and shower were perfect. Sure, it would be nice to have a view of the Pariser Platz but we don't stay in the room except to sleep and rest a little before our evening out so it would not be worth the extra. Buffet breakfast in the restaurant was included in our package.....it was truly a sight to behold with so many choices that one is overwhelmed. We dined one night at Quarre which was a very nice meal albeit I was not keen on the choices in the set menu.....they did rustle me up a nice fillet of white fish so I was happy. I felt that the hotel staff from check in to check out were great. I can't say enough about one individual on duty in the Concierge area....he was terrific about sorting out our luggage problem and getting it to us in the late evening of our arrival. (It was sitting in Amsterdam at 8:30 p.m. after the last KLM flight had departed. Our Delta flight was late arriving that a.m. - we made our connection but not the luggage. He arranged for it to arrive on the last Lufthansa flight of the evening.....we were eternally grateful as we were just beginning a 4 week trip) Our stay was memorable as was the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Except Expensive Extras”
Reviews.Author: agedbutcool
Reviews.Content: Clearly in the primest pitch in Berlin (opposite the Gate and near many of the key sites) this hotel is classy, very well appointed, formally managed and recommendable. However as other reviews have suggested - it is expensive - not the accommodation (which is excellent) - but the extras. There is no need to charge over $50 a head for breakfast or for WiFi - whilst the guests can probably afford it, it seems unnecessary - these things stick out on the bill and irritate. (Bump up the rate and make these things inclusive !) On the plus side - the rooms are modern, spacious and have great views (if on the right side) - the staff are efficient and well trained albeit the concierge desk is extremely crowded at peak times - so allow time to book those essential tours, restaurants and flight check-in etc. All in all - the best in Berlin - just bring extra Euros !

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SueMpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in every way - staff that bend over backwards, opulent decor, first class accommodations right outside the Brandenburg Gate. The pool is beautiful and heated. The only problem is that you have to pay $$$$$ for it. I was also a little pissed that after I paid about $300 for just one night they still made you pay for internet access. 9 euros for only one hour!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Casual Traveler”
Reviews.Author: BullwinkleJMoose
Reviews.Content: This over-the-top hotel hosted a conference I recently attended; otherwise it would not be the kind of place I would have stayed in. The room, while appointed with class and taste, simply did not merit the cost. The breakfast was truly extraordinary, the staff was totally helpful and obliging, and the location was unbeatable, at the Brandenburg Gate, but again, not worth the price. As with many top-end hotels, there was no free high-speed internet. And for all of the highfalutin accoutrements, the door to the bathroom came off its hinges, and it was not possible to shower without creating a puddle of water on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “"Fabulous Stay"”
Reviews.Author: JenniYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed when running Berlin half marathon. Despite other reviews regarding snooty staff, we found everyone we came across polite helpful and what you would expect from a hotel of this standard. Even when we arrived back grubby and sweaty after the run !! Room excellent, large, overlooking a courtyard but that was pleasant. Lovely bathroom and servised very well twice each day. Used the spa facilities which were also great, very quiet too, only my husband and I plus one other on one occasion. Did not eat at the hotel but had room service for coffee as no facilaities in the room (only negative point) but that is often the casr with hotels in this class. Room service fast efficient and nice little pastries etc brought with coffee. Fabulous location on " Die Linden", would definately stay on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: EamonnYoung
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fantastic and worth every penny. The staff are amazing..friendly and super efficient. The lobby is amazing and so relaxing when the pianist is playing. Rooms are great..eg. lovely bath oil in the bathroom. Only way to improve is to free wifi access in the bedrooms..but hey, it did me good not to check my emails every day !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: hmb_aug2010
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel which richly deserves its 5* status. Our room was spacious and elegantly furnished with facilities designed to ensure your every comfort - they had UK TV channels which was an added bonus. The restaurant food was to a very high standard - almost Michelin. Service was impeccable; everything was done swiftly and with charm - London hoteliers could learn a lot from them. The location cannot be beaten - we ate breakfast overlooking the Brandenburg Gate. Perhaps it was because of the time of year, but the cost was little more than for a mediocre 4* chain and much less than one would expect to pay in London or NY. Berlin is a magnificent city and this is by far the best place to stay while enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, I don't imagine it can be beaten.”
Reviews.Author: calumdheadie
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the best location I've ever stayed at in a city break. Literally a stones throw away from the Brandenburg Gate. Friendly staff who sorted a booking confusion quickly, clean gorgeous rooms. Good Breakfast. It is expensive though. The rooms are expensive as well as all the extras. Recommend it if you can afford it. Probably cheaper but still high quality alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very traditional”
Reviews.Author: Manxelisa
Reviews.Content: Very swanky and expensive hotel in a great position next to the Brandenburg Gate but extremely stuffy. Stayed as part of a chic and grown-up hen-do celebration and whislt the hotel was very beautiful and grand it was extremely traditional. Bar closed at 2am , very expensive bar ( coke about £5), no IPOD connection or wireless internet in the room. 3 bouncers appeared when we returned at 2am to a desterted foyer and bar area - plush but lacking in atmosphere. Service very poor...either slow or non-existant ( we couldnt take drinks to outside tables / werent offered table service outside on a sunny sunday lunchtime beacuse the restaurant ' arent doing it today'!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Berlin classic”
Reviews.Author: dfwmw
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Adlon, and I remain a huge fan. The location simply cannot be beat, and the quality of the hotel and the staff are first rate. Its not cheap, but if you want to give yourself a treat, I would strongly recommend the Adlon.

Reviews.Title: “Germany's best”
Reviews.Author: metropolitanguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice already and do love this hotel. Great understated elegance. The staff is very efficient, friendly and attentive. I love the the rooms and the bathrooms in particular. You get everything you would expect from a hotel of this calibre. My favourite: When I had to check out at 4am the night receptionist brought me a coffee to take away as I was in a rush. What a nice touch! If you like great service, spacious rooms and excellent restaurants - stay here and you don't even need to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but just good”
Reviews.Author: Timmmm11
Reviews.Content: We had a fine stay but both myself and colleagues expected much more.... The staff were trying but kept mixing things up and making mistakes. Breakfast was also slow one morning . Overall good location but needs to try a little harder. A room update would help too....

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but outdated”
Reviews.Author: princeadnan
Reviews.Content: Oh Berlin! Great location, easy walk from the subway, under ten mins on the cab from Berlin Hbf main train station and close to touristic sites. Spacious rooms, attentive service, welcoming and cheerful staff, healthy breakfast. Everything has a price EUR 400++ But outdated rooms? Clogged wash basin sinks? Stiff bedding (no one is asking for Hastens beds but at least some comfort)? For leisure but not for business!

Reviews.Title: “A dream that comes true.”
Reviews.Author: ludwig1827
Reviews.Content: From the very first moment you step in this landmark, you may feel at home. Friendly staff, prompt and attentive. Rooms, even in the lower categories are surprisingly big and very well appointed. Great breakfast experience with a view (try to get on the first floor restaurant for stunning views of the Brandenburg Gate). A special thank you to the Concierge Mr.Lenk who made my stay so special and remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it's "five star" attitude.....”
Reviews.Author: lpbb
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in this hotel so I would not comment their in house services. But the doorman of this hotel made me feel that it was lucky I didn't stay there. I've never seen a five star hotel doorman has such bad discrimination attitude toward foreigners. Long story short, my 75 year-old mom was born in Berlin. To fulfill her wish to back to visit her birth place, I organised the trip in March 2010. We went to Brandenburg Gate where this hotel next to on 21st March 2010. Weather wasn't good, very very cold and windy. My mom felt cold after while and I planned to buy some hot chocolate for her and I decided to go to visit this hotel's coffee shop because it looked as beatiful hotel from outside and also it has shops to walk around. however, we were stopped by the doorman as he asked me what we want to do to go in. I was suprised but I still politely told him that we want to go to coffee shop. He gave me a "look" and politely told me that "The coffee shop is full." What a amazing doorman, he could monitor the coffee shop sitting from the entry! I guess if me & mom was dressed up with labels (we wear Jeans and sneakers), the result would be different even we were Asian. From my point of view, this doorman's attitude reflect hotel's service standards. During the whole trip (also my first trip) in Germany , it is the only bad memories I had. I wrote the story because I don't think this hotel is worth to visit if it has such discrimination attitude towards foreigners and a reminder to others that you may need to dress up to their five-star hotel standard to be granted an entry.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Swissgirl69
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are still raving about the fantastic New Year's Eve party we celebrated at the Adlon. It will be difficult to find something to top this glamorous event in future. We have now stayed three times at the Adlon, in winter, spring and summer, and we always thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. With impeccable service, sumptuous breakfast buffets and probably the most comfortable hotel beds in the world, not to speak of the stylishly furnished rooms, the heavenly spa and the gorgeous flower arrangements in the elegant lobby hall, the Adlon will always remain our first choice in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob1010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Adlon is one of those signature big city hotels that every traveller should experience at least once. It was built on the same site as the original Hotel Adlon largely destroyed during the war. So its location on Unter den Linden just near the Brandenburg Gate is about as good as it gets. The hotel has been rebuilt in period style, but the interior decoration is contemporary, with a touch of art deco and fin-de-siecle here and there. We were upgraded to a very large room overlooking Unter den Linden with a view of the gate, with a separate sitting area, makeup table and entrance hallway, and a large and well furnished bathroom, with his and hers sinks etc. There is a large bar in the main lobby area which serves glasses of Moet (rose or white) from magnums, and four very good restaurants: an excellent cafe where breakfast was served, a fine dining restaurant, an Italian restaurant, and an Asian fusion restaurant. We tried the first three during our extended stay and were impressed with all of them. Breakfast was very good, offering a full range of continental and US/UK selections. While it’s a big city hotel, the staff were attentive, courteous, professional and helpful at all times. We stayed at the hotel for a week on vacation. While I wouldn’t recommend it for kids, it’s a good hotel both for tourists and business travellers. For tourists, it’s extraordinarily well located. Charlottenburg aside, it’s with walking distance of everything. I have one suggestion for management: improve the quality of the coffee. Expressos and cappuccinos come from two push button machines – not real expresso machines - and for cappuccinos they use that horrible long life milk! Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself, well worth a visit when in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Blackheathbloke
Reviews.Content: I needed to visit Berlin for a friend's birthday, and they told me that the Hotel Adlon were having a special offer in early January so I made a booking! I arrived quite late on Friday night after my flight from London, the hotel is located right next to the Brandenburg Gate so is very easy to find. Check-in was very quick and painless. I booked a deluxe room, which was on the 3rd floor. The view from the window looked on to the building next door, although as this was a modern glass building it wasn't too bad. The room itself was very big, with the bathroom being the same size as many hotel rooms I've stayed in. There is a lengthy hallway, that has warbrobes on one side, that leads into the room itself. The room had a large bed, a work desk and some extra chairs next to the window. Flat screen TV was discreetly placed in a large cabinet next to the work desk. I had free wired internet connection, due to my GHA discovery member card, which was very fast and enabled me to watch my Sling Box with no issues. The bathroom has twin basins opposite a large bathtub. Past this is the shower cubicle, with the toilet separated in it's own room, that is accessible from the hallway as well as the bathroom. The bedroom and bathroom have a lot of dark wood, but the light from outside is bright enough to stop it feeling gloomy. I didn't eat at the hotel, although the lobby bar always seemed busy (I think many non-guests were also coming in to experience the atmosphere). I did manage a quick swim in the lovely pool, shame I didn't have more time to use the gym. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel is you want a bit of luxury when in Berlin. I gave 5 stars for value as I get their special early new year rate, if I'd paid the usual price I would have maybe reduced this score slightly. I reduced one star from the service, due to a mix up with the internet on my bill as I checked out. This was partly my fault as I didn't use my GHA member number when booking, which may have saved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Luxus, angenehm eher nichts für Kinder”
Reviews.Author: Smilepic
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, nice, excellent location and service. Of course upper price range. Feels a little bit stiff. Rooms are more elegant than individual. A great place to have dinner and for prestige events or for making business deals or for meeting politicians. Transportation very easy, either cabs, or several subway stations close by. Walking distance to Brandenburger Tor, Museums, plenty upper class Restaurants in Friedrichstrasse and Gendarmenmarkt or shopping center like Galerie Lafayette. You probably would not go there as atypical backpack traveller.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfection" is the only word necessary.”
Reviews.Author: mse1125
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in ( coming through the tightest hotel security ever), we saw attention to detail at every turn. Nothing was pretentious or over-the-top, just top flight professionalism...from the concierge desk to the waitstaff at the sumptuous, elegant buffet breakfast....well, THAT was over-the-top! We were upgraded to a suite, fitted in dark,sleek woods, and refined beiges...the bathrooms were marble (with heated floors) and mahogany...great robes and slippers. The public areas were spacious, and perfect for people-watching....Elegant natives and power brokers equally use the bars as meeting spots...a pianist playing in the late afternoons and evenings. Perfect location at the Brandenburg Gate, and a welcome respite after a day of walking the city. The only drawback was having to walk through private functions in ball/meeting rooms on the way to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: chaileywealth
Reviews.Content: Situated right next to Brandenburg Gate. Decked out beautifully for Xmas. Service wonderful, breakfast delicious. Nothng to ruin an enjoyable visit toBerlin and the Christmas Markets.

Reviews.Title: “Great high-end lunch with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBritNY
Reviews.Content: After a cold late November morning touring around Berlin, we were looking for an oasis to rest, enjoy some high quality food, and be pampered for a while. We had researched various Berlin restaurants and Restaurant Quarré at the Hotel Adlon was on our list. We had just finished doing the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag so it seemed like a highly logical choice. In short, it was perfect from start to end. The security to get into the hotel was polite (if a little unusual). Once we walked into the main lobby we were greeted by soft live piano music and folks sitting, enjoying coffee. It had an opulent ambience which boded well. We entered the restaurant and were greeted by the friendly staff who took our coats (didn't need a coat check - they kept track of everything) and guided us to a table overlooking the street. Wonderful place for people-watching. We had cocktails, soup and appetizers, and a small main course, followed by dessert and coffee and felt utterly pampered. The staff made it clear that they would do their best to satisfy any culinary wish we had and were willing to offer suggestions as to wine pairings for the courses. As it typical for us when we go out, we taste everyone's food and drink and were utterly amazed at the quality of the dishes, the plating and the wonderful flavours. The pacing of the meal was perfect - just what we needed. It wasn't cheap - but for service and food of this quality you have to be prepared to pay appropriately. Definitely one of my top dining experiences - I don't think that I can find fault with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever! Rooms were the nicest I've seen--simply beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel2103
Reviews.Content: The rooms were amazing. Everyone in our group thought they'd been upgraded when they saw their rooms. Beautiful hardwoods throughout and elegantly furnished. Very comfortable. Best hotel room I've ever stayed in. The staff and service level at the hotel was superior to any other. The location is right next to the Brandenburg Gates and within walking distance to great restaurants/sites. Great location for a corporate meeting or conference or for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tropical_Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: This hotel has old world charm, modern conveniences and a fantastic location to go with it. Add to this staff who are helpful, professional and knowledgeable about the town and the hotel's many services and you have one of the finest hotel experiences that I have had in the world. I used the pool, the function centre, the restaurants, the pressing services, the business centre and a host of other services and it was an enjoyable and memorable experience. My brother and I spoke to many German locals in our few days in town and all said that the Adlon was known as the best hotel in town and that we were lucky to be staying there - something that after spending 4 days there I would have to agree on. I think now I will forever have to stay at this hotel when I go to Berlin for business or pleasure as I know it will be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and great location next to Brandenburg Gate.”
Reviews.Author: Cantstandbadhotels
Reviews.Content: This is a classic hotel that does everything right. It is near the Reichstag and government district so there always lots of black Mercedes cars out front waiting for various VIPs. As most five star hotels, their breakfast buffet cost was outrageous but there's a Starbucks across the street with free WiFi. We were annoyed that the hotel charged 18 euros/day for WiFi and so complained (given that it was free across the street). They did adjust the bill but really, in this day and age, WiFi shouldn't cost so much. The only thing, and it's a small thing (literally and figuratively), was that the pillows were very small (square, decorator sized) and uber soft (you'd need at least four to make a decent pillow!). Great walk-in closet in our room, separate toilet with sink, separate shower with 2 sinks, nice king-sized bed, beautiful decor. Staff were friendly & professional. Would stay here again and just ask for 10 pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for Berlin Marathon”
Reviews.Author: gmebius
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Berlin, participated in real Berlin Marathon 2010! All I can say is that this was the perfect place I could have chosen. The Brandemburg Gate is steps away from Hotel, as well as the marathon start - finish line. If you are considering a hotel for the marathon, look no further... if you are in berlin for other reasons, still I highly recommend the Adlon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: marko1
Reviews.Content: First time to Berlin. The weather was appalling but the hotel adlon kempinski was terrific. On business (conference was taking place at the hotel for two days) and pleasantly surprised by a) size of room - unusually large for a European 5 star hotel b) the amenities (no skimping, unlike what is now coming common in other so-called 5 star hotels (especially Starwood properties) and c) the in-hotel facilities. Check in was a breeze and staff insisted on showing me to my room. Overall the staff were extremely friendly, accommodative and keen to assist in organising taxis, making dinner reservations etc. Only downside was the cost of the internet - EUR27 per day - although it was quick and efficient. It is an expensive hotel but definitely first class and highly recommend for business travellers on the business credit card

Reviews.Title: “One of the finest hotels we've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: margot1955
Reviews.Content: OMG, this is the creme de la creme of hotels! It is magnificent in every way - well located, steps away from the Brandenburg Gate, gorgeous and stately inside and out, with large rooms and exceptional and professional service. It truly is a hotel to experience and I will now be comparing (probably unfavorably) every other hotel stay to the Adlon.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chickee12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Adlon in Berlin. The adage you get what you pay for is spot on. The hotel is lovely and the staff went out of their way to accomodate us. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location steeped in history, and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: intrepidgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Adlon for my partner's birthday and it's a great base for exploring the City. The concierge was very helpful, rooms are spacious (but could be anywhere, they're very nondescript), nice bathroom, and very quiet. My only complaint would be that it lacks character, and this place should be oozing in it. There is no link to it's history anywhere and somehow there's no connection to the city. I thought the covers of cheesy songs on the piano was a bit much and the bar area is neither cosy/romantic or stylish. But we would stay here again, and I liked the fact that they gave my partner a birthday present which was very thoughtful and a nice little touch.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: So the location is great, the pool/sauna very nice, room service really good, some nice features in the room etc. What I realy felt was that it's really not worth the price. I kind of expected the hotel to really blow away everything else but to me it was a normal 5* hotel, and I personally like the Kempinsky in Budapest more. Here the finishing touch was missing especially in the rooms, kind of expected more premium working table, even better bed etc. it simply wasn't "rubust" and new enough. Also was not happy that the airconditioner made an annoying noice so I had to turn it off in order to sleep. Anyway, all in all it's for sure a great hotel but living more on it's name then on real WOW quality.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: EllenNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay for 4 nights at the Adlon Kempinski. From the moment you enter you know you are in for a real treat! The staff who checked us in was top notch, very professional and helpful. They told us immediately that we were being upgraded(Amex Platinum upgrade) to a suite. Upon entering the suite we were almost speechless. It was quite large, 2 bathrooms, a lovely living room, full dressing room and even a private massage room! The main bathroom was well equipped and very comfortable. it was like having our own private apartment at the foot of the Brandenberg Gate!!!! The breakfast served at the Adlon is among the most lavish we have experienced in all of Europe. Every detail is attended to by both the chefs and wait staff and the food is quite delicious. The outdoor bar overlooking the Brandenberg Gate is a perfect spot to people watch and enjoy a late afternoon drink. The conceirge service was terrific, assisting us with various requests and then confirming them to our room with written confirmation. This is the place to stay in Berlin!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adlon Kempinski is a true 5-star hotel, but there is still some room for improvement. Pros: - porters were extremely helpful and polite (when you get out of the taxi they greet you with your name – impressive) - beautiful hallways and public spaces - size of the room good (I was in deluxe room) - Uma serves excellent Japanese food with modern twist - excellent room service breakfast - hotel has a nice little wine shop with attentive and knowledgeable service - all the LHW club benefits were acknowledged Cons: - service in general was attentive but it varied quite a lot. For example, the person who escorted me to my room was a bit nervous, at times concierges seemed to be very busy and had little time to actually serve you - room smelled horrible. The contrast was huge when you entered to you room from the hallways which, like majority of 5-star properties, have a nice fragrance. I think the room I was staying can be given to both smokers and non-smokers. - the hotel has a nice sauna and pool area but it was very crowded as were the public spaces at times. Like other hotels in Berlin the Adlon has excellent value for money (220 euro a night). However, I’m not sure if I will return to Adlon as the hotel lacked the wow factor. Next time I may revisit the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience to Savour”
Reviews.Author: Max2502
Reviews.Content: I really looked forward to this 4 day stay at the world renowned Adlon Kempinski and I have to say, it exceeded my expectations. There are so many positives and superlatives that apply to this legend that I can only focus on a few, and to be fair, a few minor blemishes too. The location is as good as it gets. Sandwiched between the British and American embassies, directly outside the Brandenburg Gate this must be one of the choicest pieces of real estate in the world. The connections are superb too. If the S-Bahn stop “Brandenburg Tor” was any closer, you would be inside the hotel. There are always taxis and private BMW limousines waiting outside the front entrance. The doormen at the hotel are slick and professional. At the outset you need to be aware of the legendary status of this hotel. It is where royalty chooses to stay, along with Hollywood stars, billionaires, heads of state and other famous names. As a result, the doormen are constantly dealing with curious tourists and often need to firmly turn away unsuitable sticky beaks! The check in procedure is flawless, again with a degree of professionalism, warmth and knowledge that only rigorous training can bring. Checkout was equally impressive. English is easily and unhesitatingly spoken. A member of staff actually escorts you to your room, pointing out features of the hotel and your room. In my case, the young lady in question was an absolute delight, easily imparting professional elegance. The room itself is outstanding, even though I wasn’t lucky enough to get something overlooking Under den Linden or the Brandenberg Gate. It is spacious and well laid out, boasting a separate toilet, separate bath and shower, double basin, copious storage, business areas with desk and 2 chairs, lounge area with 2 chairs and of course, a king size bed. I would only suggest matching ottomans for the loungs chairs (at least one) so that you can put your feet up. The amenities were first class, including gown, slippers etc. The bar area had 4 different types of glasses (beer, whiskey, red wine, white wine), a nice touch. The luxurious furnishings could not be faulted. As with the best of the best, you also have a complimentary overnight shoe shine service. The service was so good that when you visit the spa and come back with wet slippers, the turndown service actually replaces it with new ones. We had a 4 year old with us and he received his own fitted gown and slippers as well as some special bath items. We enjoyed complimentary water, newspaper and internet daily. A hotel like this should never be booked grudgingly, even though it is an expensive choice for most people. “In for a penny, in for a pound”. You are wasting your time if you do not take advantage of the world class spa facilities, the superb room service menu, afternoon tea in the lobby lounge or dinner at one of the world class restaurants. Service at all times is truly impeccable. My congratulations to the management of this hotel for the way in which their staff deliver service excellence. What is particularly apparent is that it is very different to the aloofness some other pretentious places might deliver. Some very minor issues, which in no way detracted from the quality of my stay but which would prevent this hotel from getting a true 100% include: (a) A large standout stain on the tan bedroom carpet, clearly beyond salvage, which was also clearly old and which I would have expected to have been replaced immediately, (b) the lobby lounge area is a grand space but can be cheapened by day visitors wearing shocking clothing and even daring to drag their backpacks in, all for the cheapest item on the menu. Really, this place is an exquisite experience. Go there prepared to spoil yourself and not complain about the price of things. In fact, this is one of those place where you must splurge - take advantage of the service to the maximum. The staff love to be engaged, if only to show off the ease with which they can pamper you and exceed your expectations. You will be rewarded with a lifetime of fine memories!

Reviews.Title: “Bestes Hotel in der Stadt”
Reviews.Author: poppel3
Reviews.Content: In this hotel everything is perfect. Things can not be cleaner than they are there. Impress is the service and the competence of the staff. The location is the best in town, the rooms are spacious. Certainly you need enough money to stay there for more than a few days

Reviews.Title: “What a great location...”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: Was there for a week on a business trip/conference. This is a great hotel - location, rooms, service, facilities, food, price... cannot fault a thing. Works for both business travellers and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: NeddyBun
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some terrific hotels in my time, and this ranks up there at the top. The room was luxurious quiet and comfortable. The breakfast buffet the best I've ever seen and the staff quietly understated and efficient. The Concierge worked wonders for us which make our time in Berlin very exciting. St the time of travel the Euro was high against the Pound which making the trip unexpectedly expensive - no fault of the Hotel -but in spite of the additional cost we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - you won't find anything more central in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanypurple
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for one night in Berlin. This hotel too my breathe away. It is fabulous inside and the rooms were sensational. Everything you could possibly need. Be sure to try the bath salts if you can - I had a bath and didn't want to leave the tub. The staff were very attentive. I ate several times at the hotel and found the food to be great. The portoin sizes were a little small given the price though. In terms of location, it is across the road from The Brandenburgh Gate with some of the rooms overlooking the gate. I only wished I could stay in hotels like this more often for leisure rather than business.

Reviews.Title: “This is an amazing hotel! Best service I have received in years.”
Reviews.Author: texastraveller_bcb
Reviews.Content: Had a group meeting at the hotel last week for 100 clients. Everything about this property (except the hard beds) is flawless. A beautiful property with world class service. More than anything I have to compliment the entire hotel staff from bell man to front desk to room service - they are all best in class of anywhere I have been. Probably one of the best looking group of employees I've seen at one property! It was a great experience, everyone loved the hotel. The location just can not be beat..steps from the Brandenberg gate and subway (take the metro people it is easy to figure out and cheap!) Loved it! Brian/Texas

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but the beds were a little hard”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Chris
Reviews.Content: The Adlon Kempinski was a beautiful hotel in Berlin. It was astonishingly reasonable in price for a five star property. Central to everything, it had excellent service. My only concern is that the beds were so hard that I had to sleep on the comforter to make is bearable. It is very centrally located in Berlin and you can walk easily to most tourist destinations. Berlin is a truly wonderful city and we would definitely recommend a visit to this hotel if you are in town.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: FRA-SG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newer wing of the hotel. It was quiet and the Room was beautiful. Very spacious, the bathroom was very nice and functional (bath and modern shower). The pool, a bit small but very elegant, was rebuilt like the original before the war. The Spa area was very cozy. The Staff at Reception, Spa and Restaurant were friendly. The location is great, near the Brandenburger Gate, Reistag, Holocaust memorial, Emabassies, U bahn and Bus stations.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: Maxeen
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful and friendly. Not pushy just there when you needed them. Nice hotel all you could need. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: kvofromca
Reviews.Content: After the airlines cancelled my scheduled flight and I got placed on an early morning flight, I called this hotel and told them I would be arriving well before check-in time. They said they would do their best to accommodate me, but no promises were made. I arrived from the airport and the doorman took my luggage and said it would be taken to my room. I check in and am escorted up into my room which was just what I had requested. and this was at about 10 AM. The public area is just beautiful. Unfortunately they do not allow pictures. All of the staff is dressed in uniforms that harken back to a period before the wars. The quality of the service is beyond anything i could have imagined. When you call for a wakeup, they ask you if you would like a complimentary cup of coffee at the time of the call. Then they ask you if you would like a follow up call 10 minutes later in case you want to snooze. When my breakfast was delivered to the room, the woman asked if I wanted her to pour my coffee. The turndown service at night was exceptional. They put your slippers out on this over sized napkin, I guess, so your feet never have to touch the carpet. Very important to travelers like me who cling to old habits, this was the one hotel on my month long trip that cashed travellers checks with no questions asked or a commission. Steps from the front door is the subway entrance, and I do mean steps. I had a view of the Brandenberg Gate from my window that looked out on Unter den Linden. That street is vibrant with activities until about midnight. The windows were very efficient in closing out the sound when I wanted to sleep. The room size was adequate and had the most up to date appurtences, including light switches in the first drawer of the nightstands, ,making it very easy to darken the room while in bed. There was a full size tub and separate shower which had 2 shower heads, the extra being flush with the ceiling if you wanted that "under a waterfall" effect. Frankly I've never been pampered by a hotel staff as I was here. Just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GraceLombardia
Reviews.Content: Located close to the Brandenburg Gate. Two underground line in front of the hotel. The concierge is very professional and helpful. The deluxe room is beautiful, with all amenities and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom is great. I recommend the breakfast with room service: wonderful! The swimming pool and the jacuzzi are amazing and relaxing. The gym is nice and plenty of machines. A really gorgeous place to stay in Berlin. I'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable hotel”
Reviews.Author: silvertonsiren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary and having looked at Tripadvisor first, I booked the Adlon. We were not disappointed - luxury, wonderful service, fabulous buffet breakfast. Looking at hotels in London recently, I think the Adlon was v.good value for money. Excellent for a celebratory occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A 'TA' Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Berlin at the end of March 2010 for four nights. After much deliberation we decided to stay at the Adlon as it was centrally located from a sight seeing perspective, it was in an area where all the Embassys are located and therefore a good chance of getting nice food, it had a certain WOW factor and while it could not be described as inexpensive, for a 5 star hotel it was quite affordable. The Adlon is an excellent hotel. The rooms are spacious and luxurious, the leisure and spa area will not disappoint and the concierge on duty was polite, helpful and made our stay in Berlin a special experience. From his choice of restaurants to recommending places to see - he got it right every time. Even his advice on where to go for some retail therapy was spot on. Berlin is an amazing city and well worth a visit but for us the Adlon was the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: keswickian
Reviews.Content: A beautiful old fashioned looking hotel, but with everything "modern" you could wish for. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms very well appointed with a lot of thought and taste. You can open the windows and in spite being next to the Brandenburger Tor the noise was minimal. My only complaint was that on two out of three breakfasts we were bid upstairs, because downstairs was pretty full. The room itself was dark and more suited for dinner and the breakfast buffet required a longish walk. Not really good enough for the price even if the choice was as good as it gets. Still, a lovely place to stay. If you want to go on a city tour please try and avoid the "Berlin City Tour" with live commentary in english and german. Mainly in german, messy and rushed and stopping rather a long time and various points to wait for more business.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bips
Reviews.Content: Combine the history of this great hotel plus Berlin's amazing past and a trip here becomes transformational in ones understanding of all the noteworthy things that have transpired here. This hotel reflects the old world luxury expected of discerning travelers. From the truly heavenly beds to the marble spa showers, no detail is too small for this fine hotel staff to offer to its guests. Being at a guest at a business convention, our food service was slightly better than other hotels where we have gone on similar trips, but in fairness, banquet-type food is difficult to maintain it's inherent quality. Breakfasts became a little monotonous after a few days, but lunch and dinner were more creative. For a change of pace, one night our company travel staff took us for dinner at the famous KaDeWe department store food hall. We had the entire hall to ourselves and had unlimited access to every vendor's wares. It was simply remarkable and I would highly recommend a side trip for anyone visiting Berlin. A side note...this hotel was the site of the infamous Michael Jackson event where he dangled his son over the balcony railing. My apologies for not having my usual pictures with my reviews, but I have only recently run across these notes from our trip and still have not located the pictures. You may visit their website for a general idea of this beautiful hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: RamziBBFR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is real history. Best location, very good service, and mazing spa. Highly recommend it as a Berlin must.

Reviews.Title: “Adlon, Berlin.... creme de la creme”
Reviews.Author: mikeMontreal_Quebec
Reviews.Content: WOW, what a Hotel!!!! You have to stay there to understand… They’ll do anything, or almost, for their guests. My 4 year old daughter asked for shell shaped pasta (which they didn’t have) and the Concierge sent someone to find it in a grocery store! Adlon is, with no doubt, one of the finest hotels in all of Europe. Going back in June

Reviews.Title: “Hotel permits guests to be abused by security procedures for visiting head of state”
Reviews.Author: palladioJC
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5-cities-in-6-days business trip in Europe in late January 2010, with all the risks of January air travel in Europe. Arriving at the Adlon Hotel in Berlin on the afternoon of January 27, I certainly did not expect or need another hassle of body searches to get into the hotel. Nonetheless, that is what happened, and as a result, I will never stay at the Adlon again—although I have enjoyed visits there in the past. When my cab approached the Adlon, we were stopped several blocks away and slowly moved, in snow, to a tent one and a half blocks away from the hotel. I was rudely ordered out of the cab by a guard with a weapon and escorted like a criminal into a tent, where I was ordered about in very rude language. I was then escorted by a guard, carrying my two bags myself for the block and a half into the Adlon lobby,. There, I was told to take off my clothing down to my shirt and trousers, and submitted to a body search. Once through the scanning machine, a very officious woman demanded my passport and drivers license and in very rude language told me to turn one of them in. She sent me to the opposite desk to do this, where I was given a security badge with the order to wear it at all times, in full sight, when in the hotel. I was told that if I needed to leave the hotel, I would need to go through the entire process again. After redressing and finally making it to the reception desk, I presented my American Express card for checkin. In response, the young man behind the counter, a hotel employee, snarled at me “what do you want, what are you doing here?” I explained that I was there, of course, to check in. I gave him my name again, and without looking me up in the computer, he snarled, “we have no record of your reservation.” At this point, fortunately, a women desk person took over and immediately pulled up my reservation and checked me in. Next, two armed guards came up, carrying weapons, and proceeded to escort me to my room, which was located far away on the back side of the hotel, on the ground floor. Not a very desirable room, and not at all comparable to the room I had there last January. When I went out to a meeting the afternoon of Jan. 27, the guard desk was initially unable to locate my drivers license—it had been misfiled, and I had to find it for them. Upon returning two hours later, I was taken to task for not having turned in my security badge when I left the hotel. I explained to the very officious official, who seemed to be a hotel employee, that I had no way of knowing what their procedures were, and it was their responsibility to have taken my badge—and inappropriate for them to be shouting at me for still having the badge in my possession. That evening, when I went down to the Restaurant Quarre for dinner, I asked for a table with a view of the Brandenburg gate. This should not have been a problem, since the hotel and restaurant were very sparsely populated. But the woman at the restaurant reception desk said rudely to me, “it will be impossible to give you a table with such a view.” I pointed out that most tables in the restaurant were empty, and asked why not. Only then was I seated at a table with the requested view. During my entire meal, other tables with gate views remained unfilled. I understand that the reason for the elaborate and intense security was that a foreign chief of state was staying at the Adlon. This does not excuse the fact that guests were not alerted in advance that they would be put through such time-wasting treatment as a result of this official’s presence, so that they would have known to go to another hotel. It was also inexcusable that hotel staff was not present at the security gates to assure that guests were treated respectfully. Most inexcusable was the unprovoked rudeness to paying ordinary guests by staff at the Hotel’s own reception desk. I also wonder if the German prime minister does not have a guest house at which visiting heads of state can be lodged—so that hotel guests are not relegated to nonperson status. As a result of this experience, I will never stay at the Adlon again, and would not recommend it to anyone. Ordinary business travels just do not matter to them.

Reviews.Title: “More Kempinski than Adlon”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes a big deal about its name, because of the association with the old Adlon, more or less destroyed at the end of WWII. Besides the location, though, this is essentially a slightly dated Kempinski rather than the legendary Adlon. The lobby has recently been redecorated and looks good now. The rooms are 1990s Kempinski and are not exciting at all. The toiletries are generic Kempinski. There are some newly decorated rooms in a newer wing that feels a litle cramped, but I was told there are plans to redecorate all the rooms. The Quarre restaurant also had a dated decor, but the breakfast buffet was good and plentiful (overpriced at 39 euro). The fitness, pool and sauna are good but they are all in the basement, so you completely miss the great view towards the Pariser Platz. All this should have been put on the top floor. Good business centre but the computer access is not free. The service is excellent, as you would expect, and above the average Kempinski experience. I would probably not stay again. For a good business stay at 1/3 of the price of the Adlon, you can stay at the Concorde. For a romantic stay, I would recommend the Brandenburger Hof (same price category as the Adlon).

Reviews.Title: “christmas made good by 5 star with superb attention to detail & great staff”
Reviews.Author: youknowyouwantto
Reviews.Content: Hotel :We stayed in a room overlooking the back of the hotel 315 , worked out well as there was no noise . overlooked a pleasent all glass building that was a reasonable distance away so it didnt affect daylight . we stayed over christmas. I really liked the room , If you are into diy you will appreciate the top quality of the joinery & woodwork . The staff are exellent and do not need reminding , all smile , dress very well and nothing is too much to ask . eating is good there if a tad formal for my liking, I only tried one restaraunt but there are 5 there so i cant say. christmas decorations are great. Area: Brandenberg gate , lots of christmas markets a stroll or tube ride away. felt very safe , no heads around the place . paths are gritted so its safe to walk . Great Place for christmas

Reviews.Title: “Adlon”
Reviews.Author: Gratzmichael
Reviews.Content: Sorry that it was just for one night, but what a night it was, Dinner in the hotel was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaCGZ
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Nice People, Nice Food... Simply the Best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but a Terrible Exit”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: We were on a two night trip to Berlin wilh two small children during xmas and decided to stay at the Adlon which I had heard a lot of stories about. Right from checking in at the hotel you can feel that the service is of a very high standard. Arriving with two small children at a hotel and getting to your room with all your stuff can sometimes be quite troublesome, but here everything went quite smooth with the parking service and staff supporting in carrying luggage to the room. We had booked a Superior Deluxe Room and got an upgrade to a suite which was just outright fantastic with view to the Brandenburg Gate and Untern den Linden. Breakfast was also exquisite with staff able to guess what your desired were even before you yourself had realised this desire. So all was a 5 star experience untill we were about to leave. Since I had booked through Leaders Club we had been promised late check out ( confirmed on two occations from the front desk), but on the final day when we were about to leave the room (coming back from a short final walk in the city) we find that all our belongings had been cleaned away from the room. The hotel did have our luggage in a storage room and we got it all back (apart from some baby food), but we were quite irritated from this behavior. So instead of leaving the hotel with a feeling of having stayed at the most luxurious hotel in Berlin, we just felt that we had been kicked out from a hotel that was more eager to make the next buck than servicing the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous”
Reviews.Author: kenpoll
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a short 3 day city break at 11am and was immediately met with impeccable service right from the kerb (from where you are only 100m from the Brandenburg gate). I was surprised to be escorted already to my room (expected to have to wait until the afternoon). The room (executive standard) was outstanding - very spacious and comfortable with everything possible required. Throughout the stay the quality of the service was first class. This is a hotel that you will remember for some years and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: cisis77
Reviews.Content: This is definetely the best choice in Berlin. Fantastic hotel! We stayed 4 nights in newly refubished wing of the hotel. The room was large and very nice! Service awesome! Stay here in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Grand, fun and popular”
Reviews.Author: Eastberlin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Adlon. The lasting impression for both of us is what a fabulous sense of atmosphere! It's truly a stunning accomplishment for the management of this property given how busy this hotel is. They've achieved luxury, energy, history, and importance, all in a completely rebuilt hotel. That said, when we first saw the hotel from the outside, I almost cancelled. Pariser Platz has become such a tourist trap filled with kitsch and crowds. The unfortunate porters (and arriving guests) have to fight their way across a sidewalk filled with milling groups of bussed-in visitors and their tour guides with the ubiquitous raised umbrella. Once you're inside, however, this is a fantastic and unique hotel. It's busy, but well managed so you receive the luxury and personal attention you'd expect for a 5 star hotel, but it's also bursting with activity and energy. It was really a fun, rewarding, comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary iconic hotel that lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: adrah
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 night, absolutely marveled by its location and ultimate service, a class of its own. The breakfast spread was something you find only in Adlon, the jam selection and cold cuts were impeccable and fresh from a gourmet heaven. Rooms were very modern and clean, a little small, but you pay a premium for space in this classic hotel. The only down side i thought was the distance to the gym and sauna, which is in the basement and tucked in the corner near the front office which is miles from the room. Surely would recommend to travel to stay in this once in a lifetime classic legend.

Reviews.Title: “Fanciest hotel in all of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KristiB12
Reviews.Content: My job insisted on putting myself and my colleagues in this hotel, otherwise there is no way I could have afforded it. Gorgeous hotel. Large, comfortable rooms. Staff is friendly. Breakfast is cold buffet, with option to buy warm food. I loved that they had soy milk available. Internet is expensive 27 euro a day. Location is perfect, just outside the Brandenburg Gate near the British and American Embassies.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of history”
Reviews.Author: KatAthens
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. One of the best i;ve aver stayed. I was there last December. The location is perfect, just in front of the Bradenburg gate, with the christmas tree decorated. Just beautiful! The hotel is luxurious yet cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: KesslerPark01
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel Adlon. Great location, good service and lovely rooms. It is, however, very expensive. For example, they charge 27 Euros per day for internet service. Our only complaint is with respect to the breakfast. At other hotels we've stayed at in Europe, breakfast is often included in the price of the room. At the Adlon, they act like it is when you check in, and when you actually go down, there are no prices on the menu, nor do they make you sign a bill. So we figured it was. But its not. In fact, its 39 Euros per person. Don't get me wrong - its a very nice breakfast, but everyone in our group felt it was a little misleading since we all made the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but a little bit crap.”
Reviews.Author: BochanTraveller
Reviews.Content: First impressions are good - imposing building, faux-traditional fittings and a fantastic location with sumptuous rooms and fittings. But then you start noticing the details, and therein things go downhill. It is not that anything is specifically terrible, just that everything - rooms, food, service, atmosphere - is not quite where it should be at this level. Examples? Well, the beds are terrible: not soft, not hard but lumpy. And the service (everywhere, from doorman to concierge to restaurant staff) managed to be both haughty and inefficient all at once. And then the whole hotel smells like raw sewage - especially the water from the shower (although, to be fair, this was the overriding smell throughout central Berlin). But at least the hotel was relatively good value: or would be if this wasn't Berlin - there are plenty of other alternatives at the same price-point.

Reviews.Title: “The excellence of excellence”
Reviews.Author: Stevemark
Reviews.Content: I’ve read many enthusiastic reviews about Hotel Adlon Kempinski in Berlin. Well, a stay at hotel Adlon can exceed all the expectations. It’s really the excellence of excellence: luxury with a personal touch. I stayed at hotel Adlon four nights. I was lucky and I could reserve a special package, including accomodaton, breakfast and other amenities. Also during conversations by e mail, before my arrival, staff seemed very friendly and helping, and so it was also ‘live’. On my arrival, the front desk employee told me that they had provided me an upgrade for free. They assigned me a deluxe room, with a fantastic view over Brandeburg’s Gate and Unter den Linden boulevard. The room was spacious, elegant, the maximum of luxury, with everything you can imagine: comfortable beds, armchairs, a very big writing desk, a tv set (high definition tv) with dozens of channels, and (I’ve never seen it before in other hotels) an incredibile series of international plugs, to fit every kind of appliance, and a separate locker to charge your notebook or cellphones. Bathroom was astonishing, with separate wc, shower and tub, and every kind of toiletries. The service is excellent: twice a day, housekeeping cleans your room. Opposite my room, was the lift that takes directly to the indoor pool and spa: what a beautiful place, with hot jacuzzi, indoor pool, modern gym, steam bath and sauna. All included in the rate. Customers of the hotels can use (free of charge for 30 minutes every day) the business center facilities to surf the web and check e mails. Breakfast was the symbol of plentyness: you can serve yourself from the buffet or you can ask the waiter everything, with high level service. In the Hotel Adlon’s property there are five restaurant: the front desk gave me a 50 euro voucher to dine in one of the restaurants. I used it at Gabriele’s restaurant, creative italian cuisine (it has been awarded a Michelin star), I was very very satisfied. The biggest surprise was on my birthday: the hotel staff have learned that Sept 24th was my special date, and when I returned in my room, in the late afternoon, I found a birthday cake, especially for me, with chocolates, fruits, and a very warm birthady wish from the hotel. It was really an extraordinary touch. I was really touched by this gift. So, Hotel Adlon is sure one of the finest hotels in Europe, probably in the world. Of course, it’s not a cheap hotel, ma service is really at top. I give you a tip: check the hotel’s website or Kempinski’s website. With special seasonal offers, this level of luxury is more affordable than you think

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST”
Reviews.Author: GirlToGirlNetwork
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've stayed while in Germany. *Magnificent Front Desk staff. *Superb Chef Concierge--Ralf. *Superb rooms. Quiet, spacious, glorious. *Fantastic restaurants, bar ... and the martinis are the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Adlon!”
Reviews.Author: tessaonhols
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place. Full of history. Elegant rooms and a fantastic lobby/lounge, perfect for decadent afternoon tea and people watching. The staff was incredibly friendly and we loved the spa and the chocolate shop. Location is great, too, right next to Brandenburg Gate. Perfect place for a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it all -- perfect in as understated a way as a luxury hotel can be”
Reviews.Author: Jamie54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adlon for four nights. It was my second trip to Berlin (last time I stayed at the Regent). This hotel really has it all. Better than the reviews. The location, a few steps from the Brandenburg Gate, is ideal. The room (a double upgrade) was gorgeous. Unlike most hotels, the hallways were lovely, with windows on one side. The service was perfect -- understated and not in the least pretentious. The buffet breakfast is nearly indescribable in its sheer breadth and quality. The fitness center is quite good for a European hotel, with a lovely staff and amenities. This place is about as good as it gets in the luxury category, and is quite reasonably priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Europe”
Reviews.Author: cunard1953
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best hotel I have ever experienced. It's expensive, but worth every penny. The rooms are modern and elegant, the restaurants and room service are second to none....and it has the best location/views in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anglophilia
Reviews.Content: My twelve-year-old is in love and compares all hotels to our stay there now which means, of course, that he isn't easily satisfied any more. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the atmosphere was very elegant and relaxing and the location could not have been better from a cultural and historic standpoint. Don't look for bargains here, though, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a perfect location for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: LondonCabbages
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant three night stay in the Adlon. Its in a great location to see the sights of Berlin, you barely need to get into a taxi. Our stay didn't start off perfectly, we were given what seemed to be the hottest room on Earth, but the staff moved us into an upgraded room as soon as they could, which is always a welcome response. Being a tourist attraction in itself, be prepared for a few waterproof clad tourists circling the bar as you order your drinks. Its expensive, but look up the hotel history - its a Berlin icon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in one of the most iconic hotels in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: somanycontradictions
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Adlon Kempinski this past winter. As it is well known, the hotel is located right next to the famous Brandenburger Tor, and it was a very special feeling to step outside of the hotel and immediately see this iconic landmark. The room I stayed in was spacious and classically and tastefully decorated with a modern sensibility, with lots of clean lined dark wood. The bathroom was nice as well, with separate toilet area and three jars of aromatherapy-type bath products on the tub. The breakfast buffet, though expensive at over 30€, was another highlight, with a huge variety of cold and hot items on offer. I also had a dinner one night at the Lorenz Adlon, the hotel's Michelin-starred French restaurant, and it was one of the best meals I've ever had. While the restaurant had an elegant and discreet old world feel, the food was a delightful modern French. The staff were also very professional and courteous, as expected of the restaurant of this standard. Besides being right next to the Brandenburger Tor, the hotel was also within walking distance to the Reichstag and, although a little bit farther, to Friedrichstraße, where many great shops and department stores were. Also, by taxi, it took me less than 10 minutes to get to the main train station and around 20 minutes to get to the airport from the hotel. I would definitely go back to the Adlon Kempinski on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Next to the Brandenburg Gate and the best luxury property in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: bhromonpagol
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms and high quality food. The location was excellent and the guest list impressive. The best luxury hotel in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “100% met my expectations of a 5 Star hotel in outstanding service & accomodation”
Reviews.Author: JJBiggs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Adlon Kempinski from February 4th - 8th, 2009 while on a business trip. Honestly, it was a perfect stay and I would be hard pressed to find any mistakes. You definitely get what you pay for. Even prior to my arrival, the service was top notch. I made several special requests including a non-smoking room, king size bed, room upgrade and early check in. I received an immediate and professional reply which assured me that every effort would be made to ensure my requests. In addition, I contacted the concierge, Chris, to book me a restaurant reservation and to send me the Gold's Gym class schedule. Chris quickly took care of my reservation, contacted Gold's Gym and emailed me their schedule. As my taxi pulled up to the Hotel Adlon, a hotel porter immediately greeted me with a smile and "hello", took my bags from the taxi and escorted me quickly to the reception. The reception was warm, cheerful, immediate, very professional and efficient. The receptionist was aware of all my special requests which were met including, to my pleasant surprise, both the room upgrade and the early morning, 9:30 AM check in (I fully expected to have to wait the entire morning in the lobby). After checking me in, which only took a minute, the receptionist brought me up to my room and showed me all the room features. Prior to leaving, she asked if there was anything else that she could do. A question frequently asked by the superb staff. My breakfast was included in the room rate and I enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning. Coffee and juices were quickly brought to my table and dishes swiftly cleared. There was an impressive buffet selection (breads, cold meats, cereals, yogurts, pasteries) and hot dishes (omelettes, scrambled eggs, oatmeal) were brought to the table upon request. The room was very large and elegant with a wonderful king size bed. I don't like that there were two small comforters rather than one large king size comforter. I often find this in European hotels and it always seems that the two comforters never quite cover me throughout the night. There was a pillow menu with quite a selection which I should have tried! The room was clean and fresh smelling. Three closets allowed for plenty of storage. The bathroom was large with a separate shower and tub and a separate room for the toilet. The first night, I enjoyed a relaxing bath and had a choice of three different bath products (I selected the honey). Great lighted shaving mirror. I also loved the heated tile floor and the bathroom was always toasty and warmer than the rest of the suite. Absolutely no noise at all at any time which was fantastic. I never heard a sound outside of my room! Housekeeping was top notch for both making up my room and turn down service. One morning, I was quite surprised that within the half hour that I'd gone down for breakfast, my room had been made up.
